item.title: Alan Macey - (Manual Gearbbox Preservation Society)
item.description:
Alan Macey thinks about cars differently than we do. After graduating from Art Center of Pasadena (arguably the best school for automotive design in the world), he interned at VW, and then worked as a designer at Jeep. He sees cars differently than us. We see a panel gap, and he knows why it's that size. He understands the constraints designers have when they design a new car. He also created the Manual Gearbox Preservation Society ( links below). We talk about design, Bugatti, VW, challenges of selling a new car, and then we get into a DEEP conversation about AI, the future of car ownership, and argue about how soon it will all arrive. It's a good listen.

New Shirts: https://www.blipshift/com/tst

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @amacey3000

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman

https://www.facebook.com/TheManualGearboxPreservationSociey/
https://thecurbshop.com/collections/all-products

WATCH this show: https://youtu.be/S9ocH3gZ3Yw

item.title: Vaughn Gittin Jr!
item.description:
Vaughn Gittin Jr is a Formula D and D1 champion, and one of the funnest people around. He won his first Formula Drift title in 2010, and has more tandem battle victories than any other driver in 10 years of Formula Drift history.

In 2005, he became the first American ever to win a D1 Grand Prix, and took the title for USA in the 2007 World Championship.

https://vaughngittin.com/

Watch this show on YouTube! https://youtu.be/AN3maxymEsU

Follow us!

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @vaughngittinjr

item.title: Brett Berk (Auto journalist)
item.description:
Brett Berk's fascinating story has landed him pretty high up the automotive journalist food chain. He only has to drive the finest cars, he (admits) he isn't that fast on a track, and when it all began, he was a school teacher. He is a great example of someone who arrived at a job by taking a different path than most of us, and can now say he's written for some of the biggest publications on Earth. This was a great, illuminating, hilarious show.

Find all of Brett's work here: http://brettberk.com/

Watch the show on YouTube: https://youtu.be/n6S_pHjC2Tk

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @therealbrettberk

New Shirts: https://www.blipshift/com/tst

item.title: Larry Kosilla, Kevin Brown, and Derek Bemis - World's Greatest Detailers
item.description:
New Shirts: https://www.blipshift/com/tst

This podcast included lots of great DIY advice, hilarious stories from Larry and Matt's high school days, and a serious look at a side of the detailing industry that no one was talking about. Larry Kosilla, Kevin Brown, and Derek Bemis, are 3 of the best car detailers in the world, full stop. They've detailed cars that cost 8 figures, build their own tools, and developed their own compounds. They are passionate and knowledgable about cars. This show should not be missed.

Follow us!
T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @ammonyc @detail_werks

Larry's AMMONYC: https://www.ammonyc.com/
Kevin's Buff Daddy: http://www.buffdaddy.com/
Derek's Detail Werks: http://www.detailwerks.net/

Watch this show on YouTube: https://youtu.be/m0Rhr-33PYc

item.title: Amazing sim builder, Chris Considine (CXC Simulations)
item.description:
Racing simulators are growing in popularity, not only because of the popularity of competitions like iRacing, but as a tool for professional teams to use to train their drivers. They're used by teams in F1, NASCAR, GT, IMSA, and more. One of the guys that's been at the forefront is Chris Considine. He started CXC Simulations, a company that builds custom rigs. They just opened an experience cenver aimed at the individual like you, called Base 51.

NEW SHIRTS: https://www.blipshift.com/collections/the-smoking-tire

https://www.cxcsimulations.com/

https://www.base51.com/

Follow Us!

T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman @base.51

item.title: Rob "Bender" Park of TRUCK NIGHT AMERICA
item.description:
Rob 'Bender' Park is one of the stars of History's 'Truck Night in America!" Earning his nickname from bending trucks on rocks, Bender is a dirt racer, be it bikes, quads, ovals, or King of the Hammers, while building many of his own race vehicles.

item.title: Mil-Spec Automotive
item.description:
Mil-Spec Automotive modifies Hummer H1s, tailoring them for the adventurous civilian, off-roader, and overlander. They add various performance and technology parts to make them more capable and comfortable.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/dFcBpVWTqck

http://www.milspecauto.com/

item.title: Peter Volny of Scuderia Southwest
item.description:
Peter Volny is one of the founders of Scuderia Southwest, a car gathering in Scottsdale, Arizona. Started in 2001 as a basic cars and coffee type gathering, it has grown to be a large gathering held several times a year, where serious metal shows up. The organization helps raise money for charities like Ronald McDonald House, Boys and Girls Club, the 100 Club, and more.

Find out more about the show https://www.scuderiasouthwest.com/#scuderiasouthwest

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/CaEQngCQE-4

Follow us!

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman

item.title: FINAL STRETCH: MILLION MILE LEXUS
item.description:
4 years ago we bought a 1994 Lexus LS400 with the goal of getting it to 1 million miles, on the original engine! Today, Matt and Zack fly to Atlanta to drive it the last leg of its Million Mile Journey.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/Z7mm0XNHdhw

item.title: Road&Track's Travis Okulski & Sam Smith
item.description:
Travis Okulski is the new (and youngest) Editor in Chief of "Road and Track" Magazine, one of the best and longest-running car mags of all time. With him is Sam Smith, a staff writer and very talented driver who tells us what it's like to drive an F1 car. We talk about classic magazine covers, how magazines and media are changing, and what it's like to drive really crazy shit.

Go subscribe to their magazine and be a better person at cars! www.roadandtrack.com

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/wsLgaCgJVQE

https://www.brio4life.com/products/beardscape-beard-and-hair-trimmer

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @tokulski @thesamsmith

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @tokulski @thatsamsmith

Check out our merch!

https://teespring.com/stores/thesmokingtire?page=1

item.title: Wrench Everyday's Freddy "Tavarish" and Andrew Howell
item.description:
Freddy "Tavarish" Hernandez likes to buy cars that should be junked, and rebuild them. Or turbo them. He rebuilt a twin-turbo Lambo, and most recently, bought a Ferrari 355 Spyder that had CAUGHT ON FIRE, and is going to turn it into a coupe. He's a mad man in the best way, inspiring you to wrench. And now he has a new channel, with his friend, Andrew Howell, call Wrench Every Day/

This show is a video! https://youtu.be/rTAF-M_d2Xs

Follow Us!
T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman @therealtavarish @heavymetalfl

Buy shirts to support TST!
https://www.blipshift.com/tst

Check out their shows!
https://www.youtube.com/user/tavarish

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTYRecH8Uqq9xtaWLrYvE1A

item.title: Sam Nalven (Race.Service, Maximum Driftcast, Drift Idiot)
item.description:
Sam Nalven has been the man behind the lens of some of the most popular drifting videos on Earth, including Vaughn Gittin's amazing drift of the Nurburgring. He's the Director of Production at Race Service, a media/brand company, which produces drifting and build videos with Ryan Tuerck and Chris Forsberg. https://www.facebook.com/RaceService.Media/

He's also a co-host on the Maximum Drift Cast Podcast, truly the most informative podcast about drifting, featuring top drivers, builders, and event organizers.

Watch the show!: https://youtu.be/izx5mPRevhY

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @driftidiot

item.title: SPEEDKORE's David Salvaggio
item.description:
Speedkore builds some of the craziest pro-touring cars on Earth, and that's saying something. They built a Challenger body out of carbon-fiber. Their 1970 Charger, "Tantrum" has a carbon front end and over 1500HP. Today, Matt sits down with the VP of SpeedKore, David Salvaggio.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/3cnNppZgf4w

item.title: Christian James Hand & Jason Camissa
item.description:
Christian James Hand has lived an amazing life in music, from touring with members of Wu Tang Clan, to his current gig where he deconstructs the greatest songs of the last 70 years, instrument by instrument, and explains why all those ingredients are so important. This episode is a little different, but music and cars go hand-in-hand. Joining him is our mutual friend, precision driver, brilliantly angry auto journalist, and owner of excellent cars, Jason Cammisa, who has some important points on the new NSX.

This show is a video, with assets paired to the conversation: https://youtu.be/XdfCJo9fHc8


More about the show: https://thesessiononair.com/
Christian’s Show Dates: https://www.facebook.com/TheSessionOnAir/


Follow us!
T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @kingtrut @jasoncammisa

item.title: Porsche Factory driver Patrick Long!
item.description:
Patrick Long has the job we all want. He is the only American employed by Porsche as a factory racingdriver. He's a racer, coach to the young driver's academy, the founder of one of the coolest car gatherings - Luftgehult - and gets to drive some of the most historic race cars in Porsche's story (917, 962, etc). He's a nice guy, a fast driver, and has driven some of the coolest cars on Earth. And as always, lots of fan Q&A!

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/Z1VmOF0gDNs

http://patricklong.com/

https://luftgekuhlt.com/

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @plongmotosport

item.title: eGarage co-founder, Ben Abrams!
item.description:
Ben Abrams is the co-founder of eGarage, a media company that uses beautiful cinematography to tell interesting automotive stories. He also has one of the coolest and most interesting car collections of anyone we've met, with a stable that includes Ford GT, Lamborghini LM002, Defender 90, Porsche 356, Carrera GT, and more. We talk to him about content creation, parking your car in your house, and what it's like to daily a Lamborghini SUV.

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @egarage @withinben

item.title: Larry Chen (Photographer, Hoonigan) & Matt Crooke (1552 Wheels)
item.description:
Photographer of everything cool, Larry Chen, and co-owner of 1552 Wheels, Matt Crooke, are here to talk about a charity project that we are stoked about! Partnering with TST, they went up to Malibu in the early morning to take photos of Matt's Countach in the charred landscape. The goal: Capture amazing photos, make amazing poster, sell poster, give all proceeds benefit the resident relief effort of Malibu. And it turned out even better than we imagined. We all had a poster of a Countach on our bedroom wall, and now you can too, with the knowledge that the money is going to help people whose houses were destroyed by the horrible fire the area suffered in 2018.

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @larry_chen_foto @mattcrooke


WATCH AUTO FOCUS: https://www.hoonigan.com/blogs/shows/auto-focus

LARRY’s BEST PHOTO (PRINTS FOR SALE): https://www.larrychenphoto.com/

1552: https://fifteen52.com/

NEW SHIRTS!
https://www.blipshift.com/tst

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/kzykthdGKpI

item.title: CA EXHAUST LAW w/ Brian Makse & Ezekiel Wheeler
item.description:
We do a deep dive into the new CA 95db law thanks to the investigative work of Ezekiel Wheeler. What is it? How much is a ticket? How do police measure your car? How do you fight it?

We also talk about Aston Martins, Hellcats, what weird car Brian is importing to Canada, and handle a lot of buying advice in the fan Q&A.

Brian Makse is a racing driver, YouTuber and auotmotive journalist. Ezekiel is an Art Center Graduate and automotive events organizer.


This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/6YZ1SMsKhLc


Follow us!
T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @brian makse @ac_ezekiel

item.title: Chris Jacobs (OVERHAULIN', Barrett Jackson)!
item.description:
This guy is car TV royalty in our book.Chris Jacobs was the host of Velocity's "OVERHAULIN", a show that ran for a decade, where a team (led by Chip Foose) took people's unfinished project cars and brought them back to life. He's now a commentator at the Barrett Jackson auctions, which airs on Motor Trend TV! We talk about muscle cars, pro touring, auction trends, and of course, do fan Q&A!

This show is also a video:https://youtu.be/2fhNtWMh0KA

item.summary:
This guy is car TV royalty in our book.Chris Jacobs was the host of Velocity's "OVERHAULIN", a show that ran for a decade, where a team (led by Chip Foose) took people's unfinished project cars and brought them back to life. He's now a commentator at the Barrett Jackson auctions, which airs on Motor Trend TV! We talk about muscle cars, pro touring, auction trends, and of course, do fan Q&A!

This show is also a video:https://youtu.be/2fhNtWMh0KA

item.title: Classic Car Club Founders Zac Moseley, Mike Prichinello, Phil Kavanaugh!
item.description:
If you like cars, you need to know about Classic Car Club Manhattan. In a city where parking is expensive and private cars rare, CCC created a club where you can rent awesome cars that enthusiasts love. They've had McLarens, Porsches, old Bronco's and Corvettes, classic sports cars, race cars, and exotics. They basically assembled a dream garage of cars that members can take out and enjoy. It's brilliant, and their wealth of knowledge about car reliability and markets is almost unmatched. https://classiccarclubmanhattan.com/fleet/

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/X6G8r9dRDX0

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @cccmanhattan @michael_prichinello @zac_moseley

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @cccmanhattan @michael_prichinello @zac_moseley

item.title: WANNAGOFAST's Blake Hutchison
item.description:
Blake Hutchison is the founder of the 1/2 mile racing event WANNA GO FAST. He and Matt discuss the popularity of this new form of racing, the relevancy of the 1/4 mile, and which cars tend to be the fastest. Is it about horsepower? Drag? Weight? Find out how it started and why it's so popular. **Ads were recorded on a cell phone while Matt was trying to vacation. Sorry!**

https://wannagofast.com/

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/R0ahTuwt0Ko

item.title: Gale Banks
item.description:
Gale Banks is the founder and CEO of Banks Power, the leading company in performance modifications for diesel engines. He has an amazing history, from building a twin-charged semi truck for Pikes Peak, to jet boat engines for New Zealand, to government contracts. When it comes to engine tuning, gas or diesel, he is one of our most knowledgeable guests.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/O5LMi8y-MTk

item.title: Michael Dweck - Dir. of "The Last Race"
item.description:
Michael Dweck is the director of the feature film, "The Last Race", a movie about the last oval track on Long Island, and the battle between those that want to keep racing and those that want to develop the property. Premiers Friday, Nov. 16.

From it's FB page: " An intimate portrait of a small-town stock car racetrack and the tribe of passionate blue-collar drivers that call it home, struggling to hold on to an American racing tradition as real estate development threatens its survival."

Watch the Trailer: https://www.facebook.com/TheLastRaceFilm/
https://youtu.be/7J2lq4SuXeA
Find a Theater to watch it: https://www.thelastracethefilm.com

This podcast is also a video: https://youtu.be/prizS9nyyys

Follow us!
T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @michaeldweck
IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @michaeldweckstudio

item.title: HOONIGAN's Brian Scotto
item.description:
It took a long time, but we finally got him to talk about how it all came to be. Brian Scotto is the creative director of Hoonigan, but he's much more than that. He's been the driving force and creative mind behind all of the Gymkhana videos; the craziest, coolest, most viral automotive content ever put online. Before that he ran the excellent magazine, 0-60, and "Donk, Box, and Bubble". He's wrenched, raced, and written his way up to become one of the most important minds and voices of car enthusiasts worldwide, encouraging everyone to have more fun witht their cars.

Watch the making of the upcoming Gymkhana 10 on Amazon Prime, premiering Friday, November 16th.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/ywbwNmKykGk

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @brianscotto @thehoonigans

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @brianscotto @thehoonigans

Check out our merch!

He's been the driving force and creative mind behind all of the Gymkhana videos; the craziest, coolest, most viral automotive content ever put online. Before that he ran the excellent magazine, 0-60, and "Donk, Box, and Bubble". He's wrenched, raced, and written his way up to become one of the most important minds and voices of car enthusiasts worldwide, encouraging everyone to have more fun witht their cars.

Watch the making of the upcoming Gymkhana 10 on Amazon Prime, premiering Friday, November 16th.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/ywbwNmKykGk

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @brianscotto @thehoonigans

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @brianscotto @thehoonigans

Check out our merch!

item.title: Stunt driver Sera Trimble & JF Musial (/DRIVE, APEX)
item.description:
Sera Trimble has been a professional stunt driver for almost 10 years. She's nice, sarcastic, owns a few awesome cars, and can slide to a stop an inch from your toe. JF Musial is the creator of /DRIVE Network on YouTube, the director of APEX: Story of the Hypercar, and spends his days traveling to film fast cars. He's here to talk about the new season of /DRIVE on NBC Sports, and his new show, "Proving Grounds". Both air Sunday on NBCSN.

This show is also a video: https://youtu.be/TE9AjAliHa4

Find Sera's work here: https://www.seratrimble.com/

Watch the trailer of Season 5 of /DRIVE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_8-7UFw3gEI

item.description:
Elana Scherr has worked for all the magazines that require wrench turning, because she can. She wrote for Hot Road, was the editor of Road Kill, and has a collection of old cars in various states of repair that we can all aspire to. item.summary:

item.title: Aus. Rally Champion Molly Taylor
item.description:
Molly Taylor is not only the youngest but the first female Australian Rally Champion, driving for Subaru's factory team. She also has a small collection of fine performance cars. On this episode we talk about her late start in racing, her mom's rally career, traveling, jumping, sliding, crashing, and a ton more. The fan Q&A is near the end of the show.

Watch the video of this show: https://youtu.be/Jxq2XH7JLY8

Follow Molly's career here:

http://mollytaylor.com.au/rally/

IG: https://www.instagram.com/molly_rally/

FB: https://www.facebook.com/MollyRally/

item.title: Eric Keller of Enthusiast Auto Group
item.description:
Eric Keller is the CEO and Founder of Enthusiast Auto Group, a large independent BMW service center that specializes in the sale of special BMW cars. There has been some controversy in the BMW community regarding EAG's pricing, but their cars are reported to be of high quality, and may have a positive impact on the market itself.

http://enthusiastauto.com/

This show is also available as a video, full of pictures, videos, and other assets pertaining to the conversation. https://youtu.be/BMfev9JO174

item.title: Sam Mitani - Journalist, Driver, and Author
item.description:
Sam Mitani has been writing about cars, driving sports cars, and living cars for the last 30 years. As the International Editor for Road & Track, he traveled the world testing interesting cars throughout the 90's and 2000's, including setting a speed record at Bonneville, racing in the original Paris to Dakar Rally (and nealry getting killed doing it), and participating in the best unscripted car program of all time, Best Motoring. He is in studio talking about his new novel, The Prototype, available on Amazon now!

Get the book on Amazon here! http://a.co/d/bwRHgrr

This episode is available as a video! Get it at: https://youtu.be/TqhFNZJqxCk

item.title: Jake Auerbach of RM Auctions
item.description:
Jake Auerbach is a vehicle auctions specialst for RM/Sothebys International Auction House. Recorded just before Pebble Beach Car Week Begins, Jake stops by the studio to discuss some of the more spectacular cars at their Pebble Beach Auctions, including the Ferrari 250 GTO that ended up selling for $44 Million, and the Ford GT40 that brought in nearly $10 Million. We also discuss the collector market at the more affordable range, the best things to see and do in Pebble Beach for car week, and Matt gives a tour of the insane, $250M Bruce Mackowski house in Bel Air, featuring a bowling alley, candy store, a pre-curated car collection, and a replica of the Airwolf helicopter.

This podcast is available as a video! Get it at:

https://youtu.be/avPGTX9pcBU

Follow Jake's Instagram at: https://www.instagram.com/je_auerbach/

item.title: Mike Musto (in the Bullitt Mustang)
item.description:
Mike Musto has done pretty much everything you've wanted to do with cars. He's done rallies in a '68 Charger, built cars, flipped cars, raced cars, and hosted shows on the internet and television. His channel and website is The House of Muscle, where they drive new and classic cars, and built cool stuff. This podcast was recorded while Matt was driving the new 2018 Bullitt Mustang.

item.title: RADWOOD Founders Lane, Rick, and Art
item.description:
If you were born after 1970, you need to know what Radwood is. What started as a joke is now a multi-city event. It's a car show that celebrates the best and worst of the 80s and 90s; the cars, the fashion, the music. People show up in GT-Rs or Lebaron's, wearing mullet wigs, Addidas, neon, and more. It's a car show with a sense of humor. Rick, Art, and Lane are (some of) the creators of this wonderful madness.

Check out Radwood's site for event info and redgistration: https://www.radwood.co/

This show is availableon YouTube: https://youtu.be/JOLpicfHqwQ

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman

Check out our merch!

https://teespring.com/stores/thesmokingtire?page=1

item.summary:
Thad Norman works at a company that makes sueprcars faster. Want a McLaren with 1200HP? How about a McLaren with THREE TURBOS? That's what they do. Other topics include driving the 720S in 100 degree weather, short-ratio GT4s, driving the new Porsche 911T, and a lot more.

Check out Hypercars here: http://hyperfastcars.com/

This show is a video! https://youtu.be/OVOumAcHKOI

Follow us!

item.title: Pro Driver Kevin Madsen
item.description:
Kevin is a racer, instructor, and stunt driver. He has raced in BMW, motocross, and won 7 championships in a 4 year period (between NASA and SCCA).

For more info on Kevin, his social media, or to contact him, go to his webpage: http://www.kevinmadsenracing.com/

This show is available as a video, with photos and other visual assets: https://youtu.be/lawP2jGwTBM

Follow Kevin on Instagram at @MadsenMotorsports or on facebook at Madsen Motorsports

Not just cool car pics, driving tips and videos of him bombing around tracks... Kevin regularly posts about driver openings, cool cars you can drive for cheap, driving gigs, automotive movie & TV roles small or large, as well as support roles for various projects including mechanics, spotters and more. Follow along!

DEALS FOR TST LISTENERS

Formula X by Fast & Speed USA (Crosskarts)

Just like Matt, buckle in for a 5 lap test of the rallycross-based crosskart for $250 and receive complimentary pre-prep and active-session coaching from Kevin Madsen. Available July 29 at Perris Auto Speedway or August 11 at Thunderhill. Pricing as low as $1250 to arrive-n-drive race July 28 at Perris in front of the crowd is available with complimentary coaching as well. Visit www.fastspeed.us or www.fxautocross.com and mention "The Smoking Tire" when contacting.

Federal Tires

Follow Federal Tires Official on Instagram & Facebook and then call Express Tire Distributors in Santa Ana, CA at 714-427-0800. Mention "Madsen & Farah" to receive wholesale pricing for the month of July on the sticky yet long-lasting Federal RS-RR (or any other Federal tire in stock.)

Waypoint Watch Co.

Follow @waypointwatches on Instagram & Facebook and when the time is right, DM the team and mention "The Smoking Tire" for a listener-only deal on the specific high-quality limited production watch of your choosing.

Exotics Racing Los Angeles or Las Vegas

Get a free lap added on to any 5 lap supercar driving experience. Visit www.exoticsracing.com and enter coupon code SUMMER18 at checkout. Available through August 9.

Hooked On Driving

Get a free single right-seat coaching session with Kevin Madsen. Great for intermediate and advanced drivers looking to shave some time, learn a new track or confirm questions they may have on their driving. Visit www.HookedonDriving.com and book the Aug. 10 Thunderhill event or Sept. 10 Laguna Seca event. Leave a note in the comments section when booking.

Porsche Experience Center LA

Get a complimentary off-road ride-along experience for you and up to 2 friends in the new Porsche Cayenne with any purchased driving experienced during the Summer of 2018. Visit porschedriving.com and request coach Kevin Madsen at the time of booking.

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman

Check out our merch!

https://teespring.com/stores/thesmokingtire?page=1

item.title: Auto Journalist Savage Geese!
item.description:
Savage Geese (real name, Mark) is a YouTuber who creates car videos that are unque in their depth, honesty, and technical analysis. He's an experienced track driver with a professional background in tech and film, all skills that lend themselves well to making car videos. He's brutally honesty, and often puts cars on a lift to look at engineering pros and cons. If you want to see what the underside of a ZL1 looks like, or which car's shocks suck, he's your guy.

This show is also available as a video, full of pictures, videos, and other assets pertaining to the conversation:

Find all Mark’s content at: http://www.savagegeese.com/

Follow!

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @savagegeese_

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

Check out our merch!

https://teespring.com/stores/thesmokingtire?page=1

item.title: Bisi Ezerioha of BISIMOTO ENGINEERING
item.description:
Bisi Ezerioha is the best kind of engineer, because he has crazy ideas. Like 1000HP Honda minivans, a Honda Insight built to drag race, and Porsche that shoot lots of fire. He builds cars the come from weird dreams. Today, he tells us the story of how he got here.

Check out Bisi's website to follow for builds, parts, and contact: http://bisimoto.com/

Follow Bisi here: https://www.instagram.com/bisimoto/

item.description:
"Sticker Shock" is a new show (airing Weds at 10PM) on Dicovery channel where hostsTodd Wertman and Nick Smith appraise people's cars. They both have been in the car business for a long time, and have owned a very interesting array of vehicles.

item.title: Tanner Foust & Scott Eastwood
item.description:
Tanner Foust has checked almost all the boxes in the world of automotive to dos: He's a stunt driver, a winning racer, a winning drifter, and he's hosted Top Gear America. Today, he talks about all of it. Joining him for part of the episode is actor Scott Eastwood. A star of "The Fate and the Furious", we talk about his new Ford GT, driving lessons, and bad airplanes.

This show is also available as a video, full of pictures, videos, and other assets pertaining to the conversation. https://youtu.be/ZUX6Lno0lps

Follow us!

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman

Check out our merch!

https://teespring.com/stores/thesmokingtire?page=1

item.title: Nik Saran of VF Engineering
item.description:
VF Engineering has been bolting superchargers to cars for a long time, without compromising their reliability or drivability. We've experienced VF's cars first hand and they are always impressive. Today we interview the man in charge, Nik Saran, about why he likes superchargers, how to make power without breaking things, BMW M4s vs Mercedes C63s, supercharging Lamborghinis, and a lot more. This was a great talk, and we learned a lot.

This show is also available as a video, full of pictures, videos, and other assets pertaining to the conversation. https://youtu.be/ZjMFXsU1XF0

Follow us:

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @vfengineering

Check out our merch!

https://teespring.com/stores/thesmokingtire?page=1

item.title: Jayz 2 Cents!
item.description:
Jayz 2 Cents is a YouTuber with a huge following, known for building computers and all things tech. BUT he also loves cars, has owned and tracked a few, and is currently modifying his new Camaro ZL1 1LE. We talk about shaving seconds, adding horsepower, track times, traction control systems, and talk about collectible cars.

Check out Jay's channel here: https://www.youtube.com/user/Jayztwocents/videos

This show is available as a video!: https://youtu.be/QmPoNXNj790

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman

item.title: Brendan McAleer, Brad Brownell
item.description:
Bendan McAleer has written for some of our favorite automotive sites, including The Truth about Cars, Road & Track, and Hagerty. Brad Brownell is a founder of RADWOOD, one of the best car shows on Earth. On this episode we talk about Canadian cars, bad cars, rad cars, 90s cars, old Porsches, and argue about what is slow.

Check out Brad's podcast, Cammed & Tubbed: http://shoutengine.com/TheCammedandTubbedPodcast/

Check out Brendan's writing here: https://twitter.com/brendan_mcaleer

This show is available as a video: https://youtu.be/QqIH43Eqr0o

item.title: Jalopnik's Kristen Lee, Jason Torchinsky, and friends
item.description:
Kristen Lee and Jason Torchinksy are writers for Jalopnik.com, one of the world's most popular automotive websites. They cover every part of the automotive world, driving cool things, fast things, weird things. Their co-workers Raphael Orlove and Michael Ballaban also chime in. Topics include fast Mercedes cars, rust, collectible cars, a motorcycle rider that let Kristen down, and more..

See their work at www.jalopnik.com

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/vq8beG4IGTk

Follow everyone!

item.title: Jeff Glucker of Hooniverse
item.description:
Jeff Glucker is an auto journalist, YouTuber, podcaster and part-owner of all things Hooniverse. He joins us to talk about Corvette engines, Infiniti steering, his broken Mercedes project, and more.

Find all of Jeff's media at www.hooniverse.com

This podcast is also available as a video, with photos and video assets to go along with the conversation: https://youtu.be/76SFZhv-uck

item.title: Motor Trend's Jonny Lieberman!
item.description:
Jonny Lieberman is a host and writer for the Motor Trend shows "Ignition" and "Head-2-Head". He drives all the things we dream about, and we don't always agree on what's good. Topics include scary track toys, wet pants, bourbon, the new ZR1 Corvette, and a ton more.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/tefDQ2fmroY

Watch all Jonny's reviews and comparisons here: https://www.motortrendondemand.com/show/head-2-head/42026352/?ten=organic:ten:tend:h2h:mthp:wt_or:na:mtod

T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman @mtloverman

IG: @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman @jonnylieberman

item.title: THE STIG (Ben Collins)
item.description:
The man behind the nameless, voiceless, racing-suit-clad driver of BBC's Top Gear, Ben Collins. This is one of the coolest guests ever, and the talk did not disappoint. We talk about how he kept anonymous, bounties for his identity, production, driving, racing, and lots more.

This podcast is available as a video! https://youtu.be/fA-72XFW9vQ

Buy Ben's book! It will help you (or your loved ones) drive better and safer!

https://bencollins.com/writing

T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman @bencollinsstig

item.title: Rod Emory - Master Porsche Builder
item.description:
Rod Emory is master fabricator who specializes in vintage Porsches, with much of his focus being on the 356. His style is totally unique, and his quality is almost without equal. He comes from a long line of hot rodders, and his accomplishments are a sight to behold. Google his car (now) and listen along.

This show is available as a video: https://youtu.be/2lD1zwESGlk


T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman
IG: @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman, @rodemory

item.title: Overlanders Yeti and Yolo
item.description:
Some people go off-roading for a weekend, or a week. These two left the busy life behind and went off-roading for over a year, straight, living out of their modified Jeeps. We talk about how they do it, why they do it, their Baja tours, what they drive, and how you can join in.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/GhqJCx3_G20

T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman
IG: @thewildyolo, @thejeepcalledyeti, @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman

item.title: Manuel Carrillo III
item.description:
Journalist Manuel Carrillo is about to start a 7-day slam to get his vintage Porsche running for the Luftkeghult meet, so he spends his last remaining free hours with us talking about Lamborghinis, 4-wheel steering Aventadors, Gumball airplanes, rally techniques, cheap track cars, how good the Lotus Evora is, crazy motorcycles, and more.

Keep up with all Manuel's work at https://www.manuelcarrillo.com/

This show is also available as a video, full of pictures, videos, and other assets pertaining to the conversation. https://youtu.be/wdHvkoV5wfQ

T: @thesmokingtire @zackklapman @

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @

item.title: Driving While Awesome!'s Lane and Art
item.description:
Lane and Art are hosts of the Driving While Awesome podcast, and part of the founding crew of the amazing car show, Radwood, a meet that celebrates the best and worst of the 80s and 90s, including cars, costumes, and music. Where else can you see a Vanilla Ice lookalike standing next to a Skyline, which is parked next to an E30 M3, which is parked next to a Dodge Caravan? Nowhere.

www.radwood.com

This podcast is also a video! https://youtu.be/XYzHkcqnM2k

IG: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapmana, @artsees, @laneskelton

item.title: Derek Whitacre and Emilia Hartford
item.description:
2 Part Show! Composer/filmmaker/Porsche driver, Derek Whitacre and then drifter/wrench/YouTuber, Emilia Hartford.

1st: Derek Whitacre -who brought his turbocharged 1982 Porsche 911SC to a One Take shoot that had rain, which is perfect - is here to talk about car and his documentary, "We Live Machinery", about the 2015 Targa Baja California.

2nd: Emilia Hartford is a YouTuber, wrench, time attacker-turned-drifter who quit her day job to build cars and make YouTube videos full time. She sits down to talk about LS1 swaps, center cards, clickbait, charity, and a lot more .

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/28Fy7QjbH_A


Derek Whitacre
- IG: @real_derek_whitacre
- Documentary "We Live Machinery" at https://chassy.com/product/we-live-machinery/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKp3Jh8Slcs

Emilia Hartford
- www.youtube.com/c/emiliahartford
- IG: @ms.emilia

2nd: Emilia Hartford is a YouTuber, wrench, time attacker-turned-drifter who quit her day job to build cars and make YouTube videos full time. She sits down to talk about LS1 swaps, center cards, clickbait, charity, and a lot more .

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/28Fy7QjbH_A


Derek Whitacre
- IG: @real_derek_whitacre
- Documentary "We Live Machinery" at https://chassy.com/product/we-live-machinery/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKp3Jh8Slcs

Emilia Hartford
- www.youtube.com/c/emiliahartford
- IG: @ms.emilia

item.title: Larry Chen - Auto/Motorsports Photographer
item.description:
Larry Chen is one the best automotive photographers working today. He is a principle of SPEEDHUNTERS, and also shoots Formula D, off-road racing, and tons of other content, for teams and companies. He and Matt talk about his swapped Datsun, chasing celebrities in a 240, Mustangs, cameras, and a lot more. If you're into car stories or photography, this is one to listen to.
http://www.larrychenphoto.com/

This episode is available as a video! https://youtu.be/g8nunGgiUzE

item.title: Unicus Cars - Darren Schurig and Nate Schroeder
item.description:
What car do you get if you can afford any and every car available? How do you stand out if you're shopping from the same dealership as everyone else? You have a car made for you. That's what Unicus Cars does: builds one-off customs that have never been seen. We think that's pretty interesting, so we sat down with Darren and Nate, to find out how they do it.

Watch their promo video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rwZkl5cuhK8

This podcast is available as a video! https://youtu.be/sQtcBoz5nwU

T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman

item.title: Photographer Alex Bernstein
item.description:
Alex Berstein was an auto journalist but now sits behind the lens shooting photos for some of the biggest OEMs in the business. But in his spare time, he builds high-powered BMWs. His current project is a 135i, bought for incredibly little, but packing a lot of good parts. We talk about BMW builds, turbos, track-specific suspension setups, and a lot more.

This episode is available as a video! https://youtu.be/lDFW2Nriwh0

IG: @thesmokingtire @fakezackklapman @bernooo

item.title: The Madness of Barrett Jackson; Subaru's Newest Cars
item.description:
On this episode we talk about Matt's trip to the Barrett Jackson auction in Scottsdale, and all the in.sane. things you can buy there. We talk price trends on pro touring cars, sports cars, and sheets. Then it's on to the test drive of the new Subaru STI RA and BRZ TS, special edition cars that are hopefully more than the sum of their parts. Matt went to a track to see what they're about, and then we get to your questions.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/DiSTu7zcgeY

T: @thesmokingtire, @zackklapman

IG: @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman

item.title: Road & Track & TST
item.description:
This episode is a 2 parter: In the first part Matt and Zack discuss the Lotus Evora they had, Zack's off-road coaching that almost led to death mountain, Robocop cars, movie cars, and answer a lot of questions. In part 2, they were at Buttonwillow Speedway and got to talk to Sam Smith and Travis Okulski of "Road & Track". These guys are fast, funny, and we have a great time. We're also joined by Efran Olivares, PR manager for some very fast cars.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/bedFTiC2Fg8

IG: @thatsamsmith, @tokulski. @thesmokingtire, @fakezackklapman

item.title: Spike Feresten & Paul Zuckerman
item.description:
Spike Feresten and Paul Zuckerman are fixtures of the car community, but their passion -or addiction- is to Porsches. They buy them, share them, and boy do they have some good ones.

On this episode they talk about owning 911 Rs, GT3s, 356s, driving Letterman's cars, why the R is not the same as the GT3 Touring, and tell some horror stories of their first cars.We also discuss the cars of Seinfeld (Spike was a writer on the show), what's good about sharing a car, and what happened to John Cena's Ford GT.

Check out Spikes podcast: https://www.podcastone.com/spikes-car-radio

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/5cyW-lVeBcE
IG:
@thesmokingtire
@spikeferesten
@therealzuckerman
@fakezackklapman

item.title: "DoctaM3" (Cody)
item.description:
Cody, or "DOCTAM3" as he's known, is an automotive YouTuber who does something we should all do: bring's his car on vacation with him. And what a vacation car has he: His current car is a Lamborghini Huracan Performante, and his last was a Ferrari 458 Italia, so naturally, we talk about super cars, exotics, as well as Hummers and other oddities.

item.title: Matt Crooke of Fifteen52 Wheels
item.description:
Matt Crooke was running a tuning company's operations at age 16, and today is the lead designed of one of the most famous wheel companies around: Fifteen52 Wheels. You've seen his work spinning in piles of smoke , while attached to the Hoonicorn, or other Ken block creations. Today we sit down with the man behind those awesome styles.

item.title: Chef Sang Yoon & Thaddeus Brown
item.description:
It's a double episode! Dir. of Photography Thad Brown, and a chef with almost as many Mercedes as he has restaurants, Sang Yoon!

In the first part of this episode our own Dir. of Photography, Thaddeus Brown, returns from Dubai! He has McLaren F1 stories, Pagani stories, and talks about the cars he can and can't get there.

In the second half we are joined by the man that invented the gastropub as we know it, Chef Sang Yoon. He has a very interesting, tasteful car collection, talks to us about cars, food, drinks, and he might have a watch or two.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/kH84GZLQYuY

Thaddeus IG: https://www.instagram.com/brownbrownbrown1/

Sang's IG: https://www.instagram.com/chefsangyoon/

Sang's Restaurants: http://chefsangyoon.com/

item.subtitle: It's a double episode! Dir. of Photography Thad Brown, and a chef with almost as many Mercedes as he has restaurants, Sang Yoon!In the first part of this episode our own Dir. of Photography, Thaddeus Brown, returns from Dubai! He has McLaren F1 stories,
item.summary:
It's a double episode! Dir. of Photography Thad Brown, and a chef with almost as many Mercedes as he has restaurants, Sang Yoon!

In the first part of this episode our own Dir. of Photography, Thaddeus Brown, returns from Dubai! He has McLaren F1 stories, Pagani stories, and talks about the cars he can and can't get there.

In the second half we are joined by the man that invented the gastropub as we know it, Chef Sang Yoon. He has a very interesting, tasteful car collection, talks to us about cars, food, drinks, and he might have a watch or two.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/kH84GZLQYuY

Thaddeus IG: https://www.instagram.com/brownbrownbrown1/

Sang's IG: https://www.instagram.com/chefsangyoon/

Sang's Restaurants: http://chefsangyoon.com/

item.title: Pros: TJ Fry and Jeff White
item.description:
TJ Fry is a pro-am drifter, multi-discipline driving instructor, and longtime friend of TST. He's taught in the dirt, snow, rocks, and on tarmac.

TJ is in town as a demo driver for the Mercedes' G Wagen sideshow, and brought fellow instructor (and Baja enthusiast) Jeff White along with him.

Topics covered include approach angles, off-roading, why you don't need a G63 AMG to climb metal, driving techniques, building 240s, and where cars are today.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/NY2FpnPqK8o

Check out TJ's YT: https://www.youtube.com/user/tjdrives
IG: @TJdrives

Check out Jeff's Shop: https://www.facebook.com/jawindustries

Matt:
- IG: @thesmokingtire
- T: @thesmoking tire

Zack Klapman:
- IG: @fakezackklapman
- T: @zackklapman

item.title: Mike Spinelli
item.description:
Mike Spinelli is an O.G. in the world of online automotive journalism. He worked at 0-60 Magazine with Brian Scotto (of the Hoonigan Empire), and was the first writer at Jalopnik. He currently hosts "After/DRIVE", does video reviews for TheDRIVE.com, and is one of the hosts of "/DRIVE on NBC Sports".

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/EztsRTwhM_w

Mike on IG: https://www.instagram.com/mikespinelli/

Mike on Twitter: https://twitter.com/mikespin

Mike on The DRIVE: http://www.thedrive.com/author/mike-spinelli

item.title: Aaron Gold and Brian Makse
item.description:
Aaron Gold -one of our funniest and most frequent guests- returns, and he brought a friend, automotive YouTuber Brian Makse. V12 vs V8s, spool valves, crashing, forbidden cars; this episode has it all.

Aaron has been in this business for decades, and always has an interesting take on a car, a few strange interests (usually featuring diesel) and a bevy of odd voices to help paint a picture. Brian has been talking about cars on YouTube for 4 years, and tested a mess of performance cars. The guys start off the show comparing new Astons to new Bentleys, leading to a debate of V8s vs V12s. Later in the show Brian talks about suspension damping and spool valves, the Chevrolet ZR2, forbidden cars, the 25 year ban, near-misses in racing, and a lot more.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/qs4aowkX0x0

Check out Brian's channel here: https://www.youtube.com/user/brianmakse

Check out Aaron's car advice here: https://www.thoughtco.com/aaron-gold-532199

item.title: Porsche Dragger- Manuel Carrillo III
item.description:
After leaving radio to work in the middle of Australia, Manuel Carrillo III found a job around hs favorite thing: cars. He writes for a large number of websites, films and photograhs, but his focus right now is restoring the Porsche 911 he was driven home in after he was born. Yanked from cluttered garage, he dragged it to SEMA in its current state; a car that was honest about where it had been. He talks to us about the car's journey, and a broken Mustang that seems impossible to fix.

Other topics include the duration of a Safari build, the upcoming Radwood 2 show, cheap 90s cars, and how to make $150,000 into $80,000.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/2ZqSs3E4kdU

Check out Manuel's content here:

YT: https://www.youtube.com/user/ManuelCarrillo3

Internet Brands: https://www.internetbrandsauto.com/blog/author/manuel-carrillo-iii/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mc3films/

item.title: Anthony Lahner of Exoticar
item.description:
Anthony Lahner started his career painting wheels in alleys, but now he runs a company that can restore or perfect the look of any car. We interview him in the second half of the show, after Matt and Zack talk about drifting and bad car movies.

He brought Matt's R32 GT-R back to factory-fresh and upholstered the interior of his Mustang, but he's done far more than that, from cutting his teeth working at a luxury service center to painting out of a van. He's learned which luxury cars are cheap, what causes some weird Ferrari problems, how to protect you car, and has some funny stories about the early days.

In addition, Zack took his E46 drifting- finally- and saw some interesting match ups at the track, so we compare the drifting dynamics of an M3, a 240SX, and the other things we've slid. Topics also include a hilariously-bad car movie from the 80s, why gasoline gets hot, and plenty more.

EXOTICAR: http://www.exoticar-la.com/

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/4YKEoU1EnRM

item.title: TST Podcast - Back from SEMA
item.description: We are back from SEMA and there's a new 1987 Porsche 911 sitting in the parking lot. Matt has picked up his car for a Leh Keen Safari project, and spent 1,000 miles getting to know it. Zack also gives his perspective on the car and its unique driving habits. We also discuss the new top speed record, SEMA truck trends, the 6-wheeled Raptor, and a lot more.

item.title: SEMA, Radwood, YouTube Project Car Challenge, and Friends
item.description:
Recorded live from the show floor at SEMA, this episode covers a lot of ground. The first half of the show features Brad, Rick, Lane, and Art. founders of the Radwood car show, coming to Los Angeles on December 2nd, and featuring 80's and 90's cars. Then, in the second half, we bring on old friends of the show Rob Ferretti, Tommy Farrell (aka Tommy FYeah), Mike Musto, and Larry Kosilla, plus an appearance from recent One Take fan favorite Lars Wolfe, talking more about his Nissan Juke "Multipurpose Racer"

Special thanks to Magnaflow for providing the means and being the title sponsor for this podcast!

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/ZnwFraa5VxE

Info about Radwood here:

https://www.radwood.co/

Check out the official YouTuber Challenge Here:

https://youtu.be/4veuWTI4Xu4

Check out Matt's Fox Body on Track video here:

https://youtu.be/LYlyQqNr1Ac

item.title: Jonny Lieberman & Jethro Bovingdon
item.description:
In this podcast we have Jonny Lieberman and Jethro Bovingdon, the hosts of Motor Trend's hit shows "Head-2-Head" and "IGNITION". Jonny has been on these shows for years, but Jethro is a new import from England, with the accent and drifting skills we've come to expect from writers across the pond. They're in town shooting a McLaren 720S, so we talk about that. We argue about the Acura NSX, Jonny defends Honda Civic Type R's cooling system, and discuss the crazy things Mercedes owns. Other topics include ICON's Derelicts, McLaren F1s, Porsche purchases, NSX pricing and sales, whiskey, and plenty else.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/3xJCGop6knE

Watch Head-2-Head here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pjz4Q0jBqXs&list=PLA97180860447EE6A

Watch IGNITION here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bVX8OAHYxm8&list=PLEFAC5D656286E89B

item.title: Alex Roy & Matt Figliola of A.I. Design
item.description:
In this episode, recorded on location, Matt visits O.G. Luxury Tuner and customizer Matt Figliola, founder of AI Design in Tuckahoe, NY. Matt and his band of genius craftsmen have been building tricked out luxury vehicles since 1992, and have set several industry standards for incredible, stealth design. Matt Figliola is also credited with popularizing Matte Black paint in 2005, upon revealing a then-unknown skateboarder named Ken Block's customized CLS55. Matt discusses trends in the customizing industry, revisits some of his favorite builds, and talks about some of the insane technologies his customers ask him to install into their vehicles. We also dissect some of the best technologies and speakers in the car stereo market. One of AI's most famous builds is Alex Roy's "Polizei144" BMW M5, so Alex joins us to talk about augmented reality, autonomous driving, and what the future of luxury customizing might look like.

Check out AI Design's crazy work at:

http://www.aidesign.com

Check out Alex's new high-end NYC Stereo Boutique at:

https://www.nohosound.com/

This show is available as a video!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aRimKNRoFrc

item.title: Chris Cantle, Raphael Orlove, and Michael Balaban
item.description:
Triple guest podcast! Chris Cantle of Motorcyclist magazine, and Raphael Orlove and Michael Balaban, hosts of Jalopnik's new TV show, "Car vs America."

Chris has written for nearly everybody. Road & Track, The /DRIVE, Popular Mechanics, and surely more. He's now the Editor in Chief of "Motorcyclist", a print/web magazine that's been around since the early 1900s.

And Raph and Mike of Jalopnik maybe-fame stopped by while filming their new TV show, airing on Fusion TV.

Topics range from the new Acura NSX, crashing motorcycles, being embarrassed in the pits, racing bad cars, Harley's, Ducatis, and much more.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/D7CuXM47nDQ

item.title: Jonathan Ward of ICON
item.description:
ICON 4X4 founder Jonathan Ward joins us again with much to discuss! He's brought an epic 1958 Rolls Royce with a 500 HP LS7, and he's got his new "Duesey" Watch, which he designed himself after teaching himself CAD. We discuss yacht design, sailing the Mediterranean, robotic kitchens, wind tunnels, and old cars of all kinds.

Learn more about ICON cars, trucks and now watches at: http://www.icon4x4.com

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/YP7tPKH4k9Q

item.title: Ariel Bravy of VortexRadar & Director Roger Donaldson
item.description:
Segment 1: VortexRadar
Arlei Bravy is the founder of VortexRadar.com; we discuss "countermeasures," radar and laser detectors, laser jammers, and common sense on the road, how to avoid getting tickets while covering ground on the highways, and dash cam suggestions.
http://www.vortexradar.com
https://www.instagram.com/vortexradar/

Roger Donaldson is a renowned film director and producer, known mainly for The World's Fastest Indian, The Recruit, Cocktail, and Species. He visits us today to discuss 'McLaren," his new documentary about the life of Bruce McLaren and the founding of the car company by his name.
Get 'McLaren' on iTunes here:
https://itunes.apple.com/gb/movie/mclaren/id1223603090

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/djJX4cjvX5A

item.title: Aaron Robinson of HAGERTY Magazine
item.description:
Aaron Robinson has been an Automotive journalist for over 20 years, most recently as a senior editor and columnist at Car and Driver Magazine. Now settling into his new gig at the all-new HAGERTY magazine, Aaron stops by the show to get into some nerdy details as always. Aaron is a pilot, so we discuss Matt's first flying lesson and the hobby of aviation, revisit the famous "Lamborghini Log" video, and appreciate the hell out of Aaron's beautiful 1942 Buick sedan. We also talk collector car values, investments good and bad, and discuss the never-ending debate of whether to run all cars on the same tires at "Lightning Lap" style events, or to "run what ya brung"

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/vQoYaIJiIyw

item.title: Tony Quiroga - Car and Driver
item.description:
Tony Quiroga is a Senior Editor at Car and Driver magazine, and secret funny person. He and his team at C/D just published their "Lightning Lap" comparison, where they take some of this years best driver's cars to Virginia International Raceway to see how they compare, regardless of price. Other topics include bad traffic, Matt's SL500 Mercedes, recent road trips,

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/xKEv23Sr55Q

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7RsbgZMqDVU

Follow him on Instagram here:

item.title: Tyler Hoover of Hoovie's Garage & AutoTrader
item.description:
This podcast is about bad cars, weird cars, and LS-swapped 911s. Our guest is Tyler Hoover, an automotive journalist who has made a name for himself by acquiring a vast collection of...odd cars, or "hoopties", as he calls them. He's a man with eccentric taste, truly adhering to the idea, "Variety is the spice of life."

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/iAcWPGh8KO8

You can find videos of all of Tyler's cars (including his LS-swapped 911) on his YouTube channel, "Hoovie's Garage".
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdEczn3MVkx_4PnMZ10MVFA


He also writes for AutoTrader.com/Oversteer, alongside Doug Demuro (and others).
https://www.autotrader.com/oversteer

Follow him on Twitter here:
http://www.twitter.com/hooviesgarage

item.title: Ryan ZumMallen of Trucks.com
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by automotive journalist Ryan ZumMallen, staff writer at Trucks.com, as well as a contributor for Road &Track, Car and Driver, and Autobytel. Ryan and Matt talk about the new, 700 HP Jeep Grand Cherokee Trackhawk, the Honda Civic Type R, and the legend that is the Lexus LFA. We also get into collectible sneakers, Ryan's personal vice, talk about how to test ski and bike racks in extreme conditions, racing Honda Odyssey's, and the 80's most garish supercars.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/pTH1IqYq7dE

Follow Ryan on Twitter at:

https://twitter.com/zoomy575m

Read Ryan's work at Trucks.com here:

https://www.trucks.com/author/ryanzummallen/

item.title: Magnus Walker & Hannah Elliott
item.description:
Magnus Walker, everyone's favorite Porsche enthusiast stops by The Smoking Tire studio on the tail end of his world tour to promote his new book, "Dirt Don't Slow you Down," available on Amazon. We talk Porsche (obviously) but also racing, car culture all over the world, and Pebble Beach. Plus, Magnus talks Ferrari vs. Lamborghini.

We are also joined by Bloomberg Autos columnist Hannah Elliot, a New York based automotive journalist fresh from her coverage of the Pebble Beach Concours D'Elegance

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/TkoxKUriIzw

Read Hannah's Column Here:
https://www.bloomberg.com/authors/AR_gYx13m9A/hannah-elliott

And follow her on Instagram here:
https://www.instagram.com/hannahelliottxo

Magnus's Book, "Dirt Don't Slow You Down," Is available in US Booksellers and on Amazon as of 9/1/17
https://goo.gl/2knLXc

item.title: John Hennessey and Vinny Russo
item.description:
Legendary tuner John Hennessey has been in the horsepower business for over 25 years. From humble beginnings modifying the Mitsubishi 3000GT to making himself known with the world's fastest street Vipers, and now the 273 MPH Hennessey Venom GT, John's business Hennessey Performance is one of the world's largest and most successful tuning outfits. He joins us to talk about his newest projects like the 800 HP Supercharged Shelby GT350 and 800 HP Escalade, teases the new Venom F5, and responds to his most recent controversy.

John is joined by an old friend of ours, Vinny Russo, who has worked in all areas of the automotive marketing and PR industry. He has worked for Lamborghini, Maserati, Spyker, and more. Vinny has recently gotten attention for his $10,000 Dodge Viper project car.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/COP60x45K5s

item.title: Larry Kosilla of AMMO NYC
item.description:
Larry Kosilla is one of Matt's oldest friends; they grew up together in Westchester, NY, and went to middle school and high school together. They began the car industry together, founding the New York Motor Club in 2005, which is where Matt got started making videos. Now, Larry is one of the world's best car detailers, employed by corporations, celebrities, and titans of industries to keep fleets of classics looking their best. He also created a car care product line from scratch called AMMO NYC. Larry and Matt tell stories, talk about their project cars, and Larry answers your detailing questions.

This show is available as a video@

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n6rp_jc0CSU


Use code 'TST' to get free shipping on any of Larry's AMMO NYC car care products from:
http://www.ammonyc.com

item.title: Joey Seely and Patrick Stevenson
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by Joey Seely, formerly of BBI Autosport and founder of E-Motion Engineering, a boutique Porsche build shop here in SoCal. Joey is a motorsport engineer, builder of the LuftAuto rally cars, and a master of setup. Also joined by Patrick Stevenson of the Motor Affair podcast, who tells tales of all his broken project cars.

This show is available as a video!

https://youtu.be/-EFXBX24EOU

item.title: Jonathon Klein of Automobile Magazine
item.description:
In this episode of the podcast, Matt and Jonathon Klein discuss Jon's recent adventures driving short-track dirt sprint cars, his broken Volkswagen Golf R, off-roading Model T's, strategies for getting out of a ticket, and what it's like to ride Keanu Reeves's Arch Motorcycle.

This show is available as a video!

item.title: The Solo Show / Matt's Girlfriend Hanna
item.description:
In this episode of The Smoking Tire podcast, Matt has his first go at a solo show, channeling his inner Bill Burr and talking about behind the scenes in production, his take on various trends around the industry, answers your questions, and is joined by his girlfriend Hanna who answers your questions about Matt's worst habits. Also, it's lit like an interrogation.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/8B8klO_9RR8

item.title: Rob Ferretti of Super Speeders
item.description:
Rob Ferretti is a great character in that he has actual opinions, which he can defend. He has owned no fewer than a dozen exotic sports cars personally, and has been the proprietor of Gotham Dream Cars exotic car rental company fronm 2004 until 2017. His YouTube channel, SuperSpeedersRob features insights into the exotic car lifestyle for better or worse, crap car challenges, and collaborations with other YouTubers. Additionally, this episode will be Chris Hayes' final appearance on The Smoking Tire podcast, as he moves on to more lucrative and time-consuming projects. In doing so, he hands over control of the board to Matt, so please be kind as this is Matt's first time live-mixing audio.

This show is available as a video! https://youtu.be/p__LPgq8A6w

item.title: Driving Tips from Austin Cabot
item.description: Our guest is driving instructor Austin Cabot. He's led the instruction at Speed Venture and Gridlife track events, owned some awesome cars, and just bought...an ambulance. We talk about cars, how to drive fast, how to mod your car, and that ambulance.

item.title: Dan Greenawalt - Forza 7 at E3
item.description: This week our good friends over at Turn 10 are back in LA for E3 to show off Forza Motorsport 7. As is tradition creative director at Turn 10 Dan Greenawalt joins us to talk about the new game. In addition to the new game we touch on the brand new Xbox One X and gaming in HDR + 4k along with Dan's love for his GT350.

item.title: Skitching
item.description: Once again Spike Feresten joins us in the studio; this time to promote his new podcast Spike Feresten's Car Radio. As is tradition when Spike is around Porsche gets lots of air time which in this case coincided with our preview earlier in the day of Forza 7 which debuted the new 991 GT2 RS. Additionally Matt and Zack share grid life stories and somehow we end up back on watches.

item.title: Noah's Arcade
item.description: Jonny Lieberman and Nic Cuarta of Bee Line Coffee Co. join us with a selection of various California hillbilly fuel for Matt to sample. We talk essential oils, whiskey and on occassion cars. Nic's family has a storied background in racing and he shares the story of how that turned into a coffee company. As usual we cover Porsches and Jony shares his experience in the 991.2 GT3 along with his undyring love for Mercedes G-Wagons. Despite none of us having even sat in the new Ford GT we all speculate on Ford's new halo car. In addition we drop a little rumor on the new twin turbo Lexus V8.

item.title: Holding Tiny Things
item.description: Watchmaker Cameron Weiss, of Weiss Watch Company, comes by to explain how he built his Mercedes 4x4, why he loves driving his 1959 Beetle, and everything you want to know about watches: how they were made last century, how they make them now, wy some cost as much as a house, and what you should buy if you have $50, or $500,000. It's an incredible kind of engineering that parallels the car world clearly. Sitting in with us again is Nic Cuarta, of Bee Line Coffee.

item.description: Once again in studio our friend and frequent guest Mr. Alex Roy joins us. This week we cover amature racing,, Miatas, McLarens dinner clubs and a bevy of other random subject matter that usually occur when Alex joins us.

item.title: Kangaroo Ball Bag
item.description:
Our guests today are the hilarious hosts from the new /DRIVE series, "Corbin's Hit Show", Corbin Goodwin and Michael Elterman. They are experts at turning cheap heaps into fast heaps. Their show is about making a cheap, used car as fast as its modern counterpart, using junk yard parts. In their first show they bought a 1984 Mustang SVO and got quite creative with it.

Also in this show, Matt talks about travel, and Mustangs. Michael tells the story of bad steering modifications, and Corbin misses his evo.

item.title: Stanceworks and the Old Young Man
item.description: Learn why Stanceworks isn't what you think it is, why you may not want a racing motor, and why you should go vintage racing. Guests: Mike Burroughs and Efrain Olivares

Matt Farah & Zack Klapman

item.title: "B" is for Build with Tavarish
item.description: On this episode our guests are Chris, the host of the hilarious project-oriented YouTube channel that is 'B is for Build", and Freddy "Tavarish" Hernandez, of Jalopnik, who now has a channel of his own. Both of them share the love of buying something cheap and crappy, and putting in the work to create something amazing, weird, or interesting. The cars they brought are an indication that they're crazy like a fox.

item.title: AeroWagen
item.description: In studio this week Pete Callaway of Callaway Cars joins us. Most people know Callaway for their very potent Corvette packages however they provide solutions for many of GM V8 platforms and Pete shares their origins in modifying BMW 3 series' and first gen VW GTIs. It's not often that we have two VERY fast press cars on hand simultaneously and it's a rare day that one of them is a GT-R and it feels slow by comparison. Matt and Zack fill us in on the insanity that is the Callaway AeroWagen.

item.title: 3 Way
item.description: This week we welcome Thad Norman from Hypercar Development joins us to talk about their insane 3 turbo compound McLarens. Matt drove one of their cars several months back and came away thoroughly impressed. Beyond McLaren's Thad shares a lot of knowledge on how warranties are affected by ECU tuning, the ins-and-outs of dyno accuracy and just how modular the McLaren lineup is.

Matt drove one of their cars several months back and came away thoroughly impressed. Beyond McLaren's Thad shares a lot of knowledge on how warranties are affected by ECU tuning, the ins-and-outs of dyno accuracy and just how modular the McLaren lineup is.

item.title: NSXGT Racing Driver Jeff Segal
item.description: Jeff Segal has been a professional racing driver since his early 20s, racing Ferraris, BMWs, Maseratis, and now the new Acura NSXGT. He joined us while in town to race at the Long Beach Grand Prix, to talk about car setups, simulators, tuning challenges, and a whole lot more. This was a great show, and we wish him luck on April 8th.

item.title: Caswellian prelude to Thailand
item.description: In a rare Saturday morning podcast Bill Caswell drops by to catch up. Its been about a year since Bill had been on the show and we caught up on the life of North America's favorite rally nomad. Matt drives a few classic Alfas along with the 1LE Camaro, Bill shares stories about the spotty build quality of his Exige and we all look forward to Grid Life.

item.title: Dax Shepard
item.description: A rare ealry morning podcast brings Dax Shepard to the show to promoto CHiPs (out March 24). Dax rolled up in an E63 wagon which of course instantly ingratiated him in the house that smoke, tires and low-brow humor built. We learned how Dax's mother built a thriving automotive event business during his formative years, how many Hypermotards it takes to film a feature and that Kristen Bell is surprisingly cool with Dax launching their family in the air on a sand rail.

item.title: Bartering
item.description: Joined once again by Betim Berisha of BBI Autosport we talk all things Porsche, Matt's ailing Mustang, the eery calm of pro drivers, why 996 projects are a headache and deep suspension geekery. Plus Matt gives us his take on the new Lincoln Continental.

item.title: Reunion
item.description: This week Thad and Tom are in town for some undisclosed business and we're joined by Aaron Gold (@AutoNerd). Aaron and Matt are fresh off the Lexus LC 500 launch in Hawaii, the Tesla Model X is rife with issues, my Fiesta is an electrical mess and the model T proves more reliable than both.

item.title: Roads Untraveled
item.description: Today's guest: Marcus Vandenberg, from the YouTube car show Roads Untraveled. He gets to drive lots of awesome JDM cars we don't see here, including maniacally powerful swapped vehicles. We talk about how he got his start, some of the crazy things he's driven, big engines in little cars, M3 and Mustang updates, and a whole lot more. Check out their podcast too, Roads Untraveled, on Shout Engine.

item.title: Gentlemen? Racers?
item.description: This week we're joined by Alex Bernstein (@AlexBernPhoto) fomerly of 0-60 Magazine, Rides Magazine, European car Magazine and now man of general automtoive media indepdence (i.e. hustling various gigs). Alex is an old friend that Matt caught up with at the Michelin PS4S launch in Palm Springs. Alex has a fairly extensive history of super modified cars including a bonkers e46 and his current "mild" 335 sedan at round 500HP but built with many M3 parts. In addition Matt shares his most recent track tale with the Baruth brothers, Sam Smith and Travis Okulski. Also, my Fiesta ST is a sparking mess of electrical failure.

item.title: BMW M-adness/Sadness
item.description: Guest this week: Armin Balg, a man who loves M3s, as long as they've been questionably maintained. Friend and exceptional /DRIVE camera operator, he has owned 3 E36 M3s, and recently bought an E46 that was full of surprises. He graces us with his tales of woe, while Matt talks about driving the Dinan M2, driving the M1, first M5, and other news.

item.title: National Lampoon's Cuban Vacation
item.description: Joined this week by a Byron Bowers (@byronbowers) a Comedy Store regular by way of Atlanta along with a voice you should all be familiar with at this point Jon Klein (@jonathon_klein) of Automobile Magazine. Byron shares stories from his life in Atlanta, the comedy scene, his recent trip to Cuba and his affinity for german iron. Meanwhile Jonathon does his usual thing and shares his experience in the Scarbo Performance SVF1.

item.title: Floof
item.description: As Matt prepares for his ski trip to reenact the tropes of every shoddily made 1980s teen ski dramas my co-host on Hooniverse and long time friend Jeff Glucker joins us for a little catch up session with Matt.

item.title: Magnus Walker & Her Lady Stunt
item.description: This week we are joined by enterneur and vintage Porsche icon, Magnus Walker. He send a trend for modifying (and driving the crap out of) vintage 911s, and many have followed suit. Joining him is longtime TST friend and Hollywood stunt driver, Sera Trimble (@trims440), who tells us how she came to have the job we all envy.

item.title: An Affair to Remember
item.description: Long time friends of ours and frequent contributors Patrick Stevenson and Jason Connor join us to plug their new podcast The Motor Affair. Given all of our familiarity we veer off track rather quickly but the product is predictablly riidiculous and entertaining.

item.title: Bro Science
item.description: Rounding out the craptacular spectacle that was 2016 we're eased into the new year by Mike Tornabene (@Mike_Tornabene) of Bro Science and GNARPM. Many of you know Mike as Dom Mazzetti but as of late he has been getting into the automotive world with going from a CTS-V, to a V12 Vantage and finally settling on a tuned McLaren 570s.

item.title: Escape from Dubai
item.description: TST's own Thaddeus Brown has taken a vacation from his job filming in Dubai to return to the home base. After filming nearly half the content on /DRIVE and The Smoking Tire, he left to seek fame and sun burns. He's returned with tales of lawless driving, speed limits go ignored, the deletion of blinkers, turbo-charged off-roaders, and his 6-month stretch decidind what used car to buy. Should he buy a C63 AMG? Or a used Ford Raptor? What about a rally car? Maybe finance a McLaren (hint: no)? Or should he buy a BMW M3? The circle goes round and round.

item.title: The Beetle sucks, All Praise the Beetle
item.description: On this episode we sit down with the director of "The Bug: Life and Times of the People's Car", Damon Ristau, to talk about the importance of the VW Beetle, why he made this movie, and why a terrible car is so important. Producer Tory Alonzo joins us as well.

item.title: Machine Impossible
item.description: This week we're joined by Mischa Pollock of Drunk Tech Review. Mischa has a new show on National Geographic; Machine Impossible where he travels the world sampling all manner of strange machinery including, boats w/ tank tracks, jet packs and high speed manned air foils.

item.description: A significant chunk of the Jalopnik staff joins us while in town for the LA auto show while Matt delivers stories from South Africa.

item.title: Utah meets New York
item.description: This time we're joined in studio by the Everday Driver crew along with a rotating cast of Jalopnik writers in town for the LA Auto Show. In addition we cover Paul and Todd's new film covering the evolution of the BMW M3, Matt loves the new Ferrari California and 488 whilst the rest of the world crumbles around us.

item.title: That Dude in Blue
item.description: This week's guest is David Patterson, host of the YouTube channel thatdudeinblue! He started his channel and grew it organically, testing cars, attending events, and throwing wrenches. Now he's building a swapped 240SX, and has a blown Mustang GT to show for it. He's a good guy, puts out cool content, and has some great reasons why wrenching is not as easy as internet commenters make it sound.

item.title: Shut Up and Gamble Whiskey
item.description: Two of our favorite guests, Jonny Lieberman and Carlos Lago of MOTOR TREND, show up in the most 'Murica vehicles ever and create one of the funniest episodes yet. Topics include super cars, new Ferraris, selling Matt's Corvette (gasp), Carlos selling his 240 (bad idea), and how to gamble with Whiskey.

item.title: She Who Kills Roads - Elana Scherr
item.description:
Today on the podcast, Road Kill Editor Elana Scherr! She earned her stripes writing for HOT ROD, and now heads up the new entity that has become famous for totally bonkers car construction. She has more cars than you do butter knives, some of which work. We're excited for her new position, as Road Kill preachers the gospel of building fun.

Also discussed are suspicious neighbors, class car trends, Zack broke his own rule of German car ownership and bought a 2002 BMW M3, Matt goes to Mountune, and someone bought a dump truck.

http://www.roadkill.com/

item.title: Car and Driver and Planer
item.description: Aaron Robinson, Senior Editor at Car and Driver, returns! He who battles Lamborghinis, talks to us about getting his pilots license, what to do when your radio fails, how long a vintage Lambo will run for, and Matt got the Focus RS down to Mountune for some impressive power upgrades..

item.title: Ferrari Tony
item.description: This week we're joined by Venice local by way of the UK; Mr. Tony Rackley (aka Ferrari Tony). Tony has lived one hell of a life and shares stories of emergency panamanian boat repairs, partying on the Sunset Strip, sailing with Sex Pistols and his love for early british punk.

item.title: Pennsylvania 2
item.description: Its been a while but we're once again joined by Doug "The Bane of CarMax" DeMuro. Doug arrives in the splendor of a Hyundai Tucson and regails is with tails of touring this great nation in his Aston Martin Vantage, being hassled by "the man" with head in parking rules and speeding tickets of wich can be paid with alarming immediacy. In addition Matt shares his experience at The Grand Tour and we all share stories of over-eager fans.

item.title: Two Couches One Xbox
item.description: This week we're once again joined by Carlos Lago. Calos shares his thoughts on the Focus RS, GT350R, Camaro SS 1LE and the McLaren 570s. Matt's Mustang project has incurred yet another setback in the form of a broken distributor but that pain was slightly alleviated by getting to spend some quality time with John Bothwell and one of his insane Pur Sang Bugatti tributes. Additionally Matt and Carlos share their experience at the 2016 Woodward Dream Cruise.

item.title: Burning Sensation
item.description: Fresh back from Burning Man Zack shares his stories from The Playa. Jonathon Klein joins us once again to share his story of a Tesla Model S atop Mt. Baldy. Finally we cover the tuner car shootout that Matt and Zack just wrapped up with the rest of the /Drive crew.
item.author: Matt Farah & Zack Klapman
Matt Farah & Zack Klapman
item.subtitle: Fresh back from Burning ManZackshares his stories from The Playa.Jonathon Kleinjoins us once again to share his story of a Tesla Model S atop Mt. Baldy. Finally we cover the tuner car shootout that Matt and Zack just wrapped up with the rest of the /Driv
item.summary: Fresh back from Burning Man Zack shares his stories from The Playa. Jonathon Klein joins us once again to share his story of a Tesla Model S atop Mt. Baldy. Finally we cover the tuner car shootout that Matt and Zack just wrapped up with the rest of the /Drive crew.

item.title: JayzTwoCents
item.description: This week we're joined by a man that has proven very popular in the gaming scene on YouTube Jay of JayzTwoCents. Jay reviews all manner of high-end gaming hardware in the PC world but as many of his fans already know he's really big into the automotive scene as well. Jay rolled up in his highly modified Nissan 370z and shares his love of track days and diving into the technical details of fine tuning a car for track and canyon duty. In addition we cover how Jay built his YouTube presence the differences between covering tech and automotive and we learn a little bit about Jay's old projects.

item.title: Notarious
item.description: This week we're joined by old friend and TST alumni George "Motoman" Notaras. George shares his extensive travel log, his lust for a 427 C3 Corvette and his take on the new 718 Porsche Boxter and Cayman.

item.title: Pikey Pressure
item.description: This week Matt, Zack and I catch up on compound turbocharged McLarens, Huracans, wildfires and Jonathan Ward's new Icon Caprice. In the second half of the show Zack sits down with pro driver and /Drive contributor TJ Fry. Additionally we cover the Caterham 420r, British sheep and Matt says goodbye to the Focus RS.

In the second half of the show Zack sits down with pro driver and /Drive contributor TJ Fry. Additionally we cover the Caterham 420r, British sheep and Matt says goodbye to the Focus RS.

item.title: Cheap Porsches Exist
item.description: AJ Gordon (formerly of The Petersen Automotive Museum) and Chris Fussner of MotorHistory.com join us to talk about how to buy a great cheap Porsche, AJ's future in vans, new BMWs, off-roading badly, the "under-appreciated" Honda Del Sol and tons more.

item.title: Everyday Occurrence
item.description:
On this episode we are joined by Paul Schmucker and Todd Deeken of Everyday Driver. These two are the most underrated team in automotive media, putting out excellent video reviews, and even two feature films.

We discussed Ford Focus RS vs The World, how to go to the Nurburgring, which race track we would choose (if we could only drive one), the secrets roads of Utah, and a lot more.

item.title: Tomato Fingernails
item.description: Fresh back from /Drive shoots Matt and Zack share what they can about that trip. Luckily that includes a review of the new Bentley Bentayaga and some quality time in a little car known as the BMW M1. From there we compare notes on closed-cell memory foam mattresses, rentall car bait-and-switch tactics, how Audi buyers don't care about emissions and the utter shit of Nissan CVTs. Halfway through Patrick Stevenson of Motor Affair stops by with a painting of Matt's former DeLorean and we dive into the world of BMW.
