item.title: Carlos Lago- Silent no More
item.description: The masked man, Carlos Lago, is back! He's returned I work at Motor Trend, and we celebrated his newly regained freedom of speech. GT350 or M2? Caymans, 240s, Camaro SSss, and more.

item.title: SEMA Sprain
item.description: Dieter Heinz Kijora of HG Motorsports joins us along with Patrick Stevenson. We do our usual thing but along the way Dieter shares the impressively deep background his family has in Souther California motoring history, also we learn how Matt ended up in a sling several years ago.

item.title: of Gatebil and Matchmaking
item.description: This week we're joined by Larry Chen (@driftfotos) of Speedhunters and friend of the show Spike Feresten (@spikeferesten) of Car Matchmaker. This week we talk about Larry's experience traveling to the Gatebil festivil in Norway. Spike and Larry predictably dote upon Porsche, Spike tells us about throwing out the first pitch at Dodger stadium. We learn all about Tommy Lasorda's testicles and Larry gives us a lot of insight into RWB.

item.title: Jenner Racing
item.description: Once again we're joined by Tony Quiroga of Car And Driver. This week we cover the Fiata, fuel economy tests betwen a Hellcat, Ferrari F12 and a Sequoia, how best to avoid tickets if you happen to be a journalist, obscure japanese micro cars and the mythical Porsche F1 engines.

item.title: Trailer Time
item.description: This week Andrew Collins (@andr3wcollins) from Jalopnik joins us as Bring A Trailer auctions off Matt's DeLorean while we record the podcast. Additionally we review the new all-turbo non-turbo 911 lineup, Andrew shares his desert racing experience and his recent trip to Pikes Peak.

item.title: Mechanical Sympathy
item.description: This week Matt bids a farewell to his R32 Skyline, we deride picky DeLorean owners as Matt's car goes up on Bring a Trailer, discuss Top Gear and review the base 997.2 Porsche Carrera.

item.title: Trailer Time
item.description: This week Larry Webster of Hagerty joins us to talk Pebble Beach, racing and 911s. Larry starts off with tails of an E46 procrastination special, shares his story of moving from engineering to journalism and recounts a fairly epic day on Tail of the Dragon. Additionally Matt is seriously considering selling the DeLorean and we talk about the Exocet Miata conversion.

item.title: My Breakfast with Jerry
item.description: Travis Okulski (@tokulski) of Road and Track joins us as he makes his way through California in a glorious new Aston Martin. Matt prepares for a possible sale of his Skyline and Delorean whilst Zack and myself hurl quips of varying efficacy into the mix as usual.

item.title: Taraf my Lagonda
item.description: Gracing us with his presence once again, regular guest and Motor Trend ambassador Jonny Lieberman joins us on mic. This week Jonny shares his thoughs on the R8 V10+, the 488 GTB is lavished with praise, the oppulence of the Lagonda Taraf is conveyed and once again Jonny sings praise of his beloved G65 AMG.

item.title: Back to 1985
item.description: This week we're joined by Joe Walser the man behind the restoration of the Time Machine (DeLorean) from Back to the Future. Matt fully indulges in the most obscure details of Joe's adventure in restoring the movie car. Joe also gives us a crash course on the multitude of supply houses used for prop creation that helped out with the restoration effort.

item.title: Jessi Combs
item.description: We're joined once again by everybody's favorite fabricator, off-road racing, world speed record holder Jessi Combs. Jessi shares her tales of Baja, King of Hammers and some details about I Am The Real Deal a coalition of women in automotive and industrial businesses that encourage women to pursue their love of industrial and automotive jobs and interests.

item.title: Thriftmaster
item.description: Jonathan Ward of Icon joins us once again; this time in the newly built Chevy Thrifmaster Derelict. We of course talk about what is cooking at Icon these days but Jonathan also fills us in on his current time at the Art Center College of Design and the finer details in Koenigsegg and Pagani carbon work. In addition Matt reviews the Superformance GT40 the Luftgekühlt Porsche event is discussed and Jonathan promotes the Cars and Casino night for the Go Campaign.

item.title: Real to Reel
item.description: Our old friend Aaron Gold joins us once again, this time we almost sort-of get on the topic of the automotive industry. In the mean time, Aaron shares stories from when he worked for Gale Banks, the difference between and exhaust brake and jake brake, the finer points of horse ownership, how Android is snooping on our conversations, Matt's mother's minor obsession with writing instruction manuals, and of course knock-off GoPros.

item.title: Highway Cured Meats
item.description: Our old friend Vinny Russo now of Maserati stops by for a rare afternoon podcast. Matt gives us his take on the new 718 Boxster after a trip to Portugal with Porsche, Vinny dishes out info on the new Maserati Levante crossover, we lust over Buick Rivieras, Thad mispronounces milk and we debate if given the chance would be buy our first cars over again.

item.title: Podcasting Explained
item.description: Joining us this week is Jason Fenske (@JasonFenske13) but you guys know him best as the guy on Engineering Explained on YouTube. Jason gives us his background story, we discuss the growth of the channel and he of course schools us all on a couple topics. Additionally we cover... go carts, vehicle weight, Portland, podcasts vs. video content, twin scroll turbos, driving a manual and fork lifts.

item.title: Most Jalopnik podcast ever?
item.description: No it's not. However we do have Andrew Collins (@andr3wcollins) and Freddy "Tavarish" Hernandez (@APiDAOnline) -both of Jalopnik- in the studio this week after their Easter Jeep Safari adventure. We cover the 2016 Wrangler Willys Wheeler they used in Moab, enduro cross, Matt compares the Honda Pilot and the Acura MDX, reminiscing of cheap Vegas adventures happens, Peking to Paris is explored and finally Freddy gives Zack advice on modifying used E36s and IS300s and the pitfalls that ensues.

item.title: Hand Cranked Vapes
item.description: Returning from the forbidden zone; Carlso Lago (@CarlosLago) joins us alongside Joe Carioti (@JoeQCar) of ShoutEngine and Just Cool Enough. Matt and Zack spent some quality time with the new GT350R, BMW M2, Cayman GT4, CTS-V, ATS-V and F-Type R. Opinions are of course shared, we also discuss the merits of the 240SX, how great the new Honda Civic is and we bow to the rolling throne of madness that is the McLaren 675LT.

item.title: Hemishperical Swap
item.description: Taking a break from drop-bears, home built rally cars, and rogue Darbys this week we're joined by Andrew Lamb and Caswal Parker of Camshaft Sofware the company behind Automation. If your memory is up to snuff you may remember these guys from the New Zealand adventures last year; this time they're stateside and heading to GDC in San Francisco. In addition we're joined by Thad fresh off a flight from the UAE where he has been working for the last month.

item.title: King of Beaters - Rob Ferretti
item.description: What do you do after you've done countless road rallies and ran a successful exotic car rental company? You do crazy things in cheap beater cars. That's what our friend, Rob Ferretti, does. We couldn't believe the quality of cars he bought, and what he did to them in Florida. Wow.

item.title: Hotel Fiesta eSTee' - Bill Caswell
item.description: Bill Caswell returns! The man who built turned $500 car into a WRC legend, and lives a life that fits his website (Buildraceparty.com), tells stories of sleeping in a car at the Monaco Grand Prix, how to sneak into F1 races, and what the Focus RS was like to drift.

item.title: Betim's Twofer
item.description: We are once again joined by our good friend Betim Berisha of BBI Autosport, to talk Porsches, Mustangs, and crashing cars. Betim shares his knowledge on building large displacement Porsches, the ridiculous value proposition of a used 996 and some nearly unbelievable speeds he has achived in runway cars.

item.summary: We are once again joined by our good friend Betim Berisha of BBI Autosport, to talk Porsches, Mustangs, and crashing cars. Betim shares his knowledge on building large displacement Porsches, the ridiculous value proposition of a used 996 and some nearly unbelievable speeds he has achived in runway cars.

item.title: Gif vs. Gif
item.description: This week Matt Farah, Zack Klapman and Chris Hayes catch up on the news and press cars. Notably we discuss Matt LeBlanc joining the Top Gear cast, Matt and Zack share their experience with the ATS-V Coupe, and we talk about what dictates a V6 exhaust note. Additionally Matt dynos the Mustang, takes a G500 off road and spends some time in a Porsche 928.

item.title: And On That Bombshell - Richard Porter
item.description:
This week we're joined by former BBC Top Gear Sript Wizard (Supervisor) Richard Porter (@SniffPetrol)! His new book, And On That Bombshell, chronicles his 13 years working on Top Gear. We tell him about Californian methamphetamime production, and he tells us all about how Top Gear was made, including Richard Hammond's skills at entering strip clubs.

Click here to get your copy of And On That Bombshell

item.title: Get the Denali
item.description: This week we're closing out 2015 with comedian and proprietor of http://www.racingjunk.com/ Ralph Guerra (@RalphComedy). Ralph arrives in his newly purchased Taurus SHO, we talk a bit about RacingJunk, cover Netflix binging on Making a Murderer, Matt gets the Mustang back from its latest round of repairs, I give up a little info on what the Mosler Twinstar was actually like and Ralph shares stories about doing bad standup in strip clubs.

item.title: It's Log! (not from Blammo)
item.description:
This week we're joined by Nick from VF Engineering makers of absolutely silly supercharger kits. You should be familiar with their work as we've released videos on a few of their cars over the years. However Matt just got some hands on time with their supercharged Huracan kit and it's more-or-less b@tshit insane. In addition we hit on a bunch of supercharger tech, Nick fills us in on some of their other product offerings and we answer listener questions.

... and yes we talk about the giant log that was being dragged with reckless abandone behind a pickup

item.title: Geländebate
item.description: Returning to the podcast Jonny Lieberman (@mt_loverman) of Motor Trend joins us. This week we have the great G-Wagon debate of 2015 over the Mercedes G63 AMG, Jonny attends the Audi A4 launch, Matt reviews the new turbocharged Ferrari California and VF Engineering Supercharged Lamborghini Huracan, Jonny relays his love for the 2016 Camaro SS and we all wax poetically on California canyons and how not to drive an Lexus RC-F in them.

item.description: In what is hands down the biggest episode of the podcast ever we're joined by many of our friends to celebrate 4 years of work and 200 published episodes.

item.title: Turbo not Turbo
item.description: Mike Spinelli is back in California for the Aston Martin full-line drive and he graces us with his presence on the podcast yet again. Matt returned home to find his Vanquish with a new transmission, we swap stories from the premier of Apex and we give a quick review of "And On That Bombshell".

item.title: Everyday Some of the Time
item.description: This week; long time friends of the show Paul and Todd of Everyday Driver join us once again. Matt decied it was a good idea to take a G63 AMG out on the track at Buttonwillow to see if he could somehow invent a new kind of understeer, Todd took the LS400 out to Miller Motorsports park, I curse a shitty Uber ripoff, Randy Pobst knows how to tune suspension and interior designers do their best research upon the commode.

item.title: The Tenerife Affair
item.description: This week we bring you an onslaught of automotive industry asshattery, with too many damned people in the room. We're joined by Mike Spinelli, Travis Okulski, Brendan McAleer and Austin Cabot. Mike gives us his take on on the Porsche GT3 RS as well as an overview of the soundtrack to Dante's Peak, Stevee Nicks encounters and a young boy's take on Burt Monroe. Travis gives us some insight into the Ferrari F12 TDF as well as his take on unnecessarily ostentatious german press tours. Whilst Brendan and Austin take a far more measured approach jabbing with the occassional one-liner or groan inducing pun as we power our way through two power outages mid show.

item.title: SEMA 2015
item.description: Fresh back from SEMA Jonathon Klein (@jonathon_klein) and I give the guys our take on the 2015 show, Matt gives us his take on the new Miata, Jeff Glucker leaves us with his impressions of the 2016 Camaro SS and Matt buys a Skyline. Additionally we cover recumbant bicycles, the Yamaha concept, bolt on flares, a quick take on the Huracan and leasing rims.

item.title: We Rollin'
item.description:
This week Matt reviews the Cobb Ecoboost Mustang as well as their 911 Turbo, Zack returns with stories of Mexico city and I brace myself for the horrors of SEMA.

I'd write a longer description however I'm posting this from SEMA and my motivation for anything beyond sleep right now is absolutely nil.

item.title: Of Gainesville
item.description: Recording on Back to the Future Day Matt arrives somewhat annoyed at the prevelance of commentary on his DeLorean. Matt's annoyance is tempered with a recent to the FIRM rally school in Florida where the guys all got turns to abuse some of their finest rally vehicles, a Miata and strangely enough a Tahoe. In addition to rallying Matt brings tales of runway racing from Shift Sector, we discuss hydraulic handbrakes, the new McLaren 570s and the new NSX.

item.title: Fetchin' the Lexus
item.description: The million mile LS400 has its first major failure, Matt covets 2 stroke mopeds and an R33 Skyline, a 740 Horsepower Golf is launched, Zack goes offroading in an E30 w/ Musto and Thad and I dread an upcoming Vegas trip.

item.title: The Violence of Dairy w/ Mr. Regular and The Roman
item.description: This week your ears will be assaulted with a cacaphony of grunts, chode jokes and literary references as we welcome back our friends Mr. Regular and The Roman of Regular Car Reviews (@RegularCars). On the final evening of the Pacific Fister tour the guys drop by and we catch up on the trip, life as a burgeoning internet celebrities and project cars. In addition we cover the tragic loss of the LS400s transmission, Nino's Vine account, first class bathrooms, vape pens and how Portland has become a parody of itself.

item.title: Precipitation
item.description: This week Matt and I sit down and attempt to escape our hectic schedules and catch up a bit. Matt got some seat time in a GT350 he also had a Lexus RC F (which we've both become big fans of) I've been hacking away at Ford Sync 3, and I may have uncovered what looks to be a proper dual clutch for the C7 manufactured by Tremec.

item.title: The Boardroom
item.description: This week we're joined by JF Musial (@JFMusial) and we're recording on my backup analog rig. Matt reviews the Rezvani Beast, we talk about the VW diesel scandal, we cover the ATS-V, the impending rise of Volvo is foretold, Matt orders his Focus RS and I review the Logitech G920 wheel for XBox.

item.title: Turning Japanese
item.description: This week we're once again joined by Jonathon Klein (@Jonathon_Klein) of Boldride.co as Matt and Thad return with stories from the latest /Drive shoot in Japan. Matt got to spend some quality time with both R34 and R35 GTRs shortly before he and Thad were barred from entering Japanese bars on account of Tattoos, Jonathon waxes poetically about the Morgan 3 wheeler, we talk a bit about All Cars Go To Heaven 2, the new Miata is discussed and we work tubas and slide whistles into the mix as well.

item.title: Happy Forza Day
item.description: It's Forza 6 launch day and the the guys are back from Texas. This week Matt and I attended the Hoonigan Donut Shop opening day, we ponder the differences between ginger based beverages, Matt drives the Sector 111 Drakan, an ATS-V is discussed, Zack entertains with stories of Burning Man, i finished the Fiesta ST build, and Matt reviews the BMW i3.

item.title: Exhausting Leak
item.description: Thad, Matt and I sit down prior to their departure to film the season finalé for /Drive. Matt and I give updates on the Mustand and Fiesta projects respectively, we discuss suspenion at length touching on the merits of magnetic ride control vs. coilovers, the ATS-V and C63 are seriously impressive machines so much so that they're nipping at the heels of the Ferrari 458 and 911 GT3 and there are bargain bin Aston Martins up for the taking. Additionally I give my first impressions of Forza 6 and we answer listener questions.

item.title: Fiesta Fiesta Fiesta
item.description: This week we're joined by "BarkM" (@BarkM302) of The Truth about Cars and our own Jeff Glucker (@JGlucker) of Hooniverse and Beer Snob. With a full 60% of the people on the podcast this week owning Fiesta STs we of course cover the virtues of these diminuitive giants. Thad hustled his Fiesta up the Virginia City Hillclimb, I completed the upgrades on my car courtesy of Mountune, Powerflex, MagnaFlow and Pierce Motorsports and "BarkM" tells us why his Boss 302 doesn't get much use. Matt fresh back from Detroit is under embargo however he returns with stories of general lawlessness updates on the Mustang and a brief comparison between the Hellcat and CTS-V. In addition "BarkM" reviews the 2015 911 GT3 (991) and we look back once again at investment opportunities missed from the early 90s.,

item.title: Building a f*ck yurt.
item.description: This week Matt, Bill and I talk Audis, Evos, Mustangs and one-takes. In addition we cover a supercharged Civic Si, building a yurt for Burning Man, the GT350 launch, and discuss open vs closed cockpit cars in the wake of Justin Wilson's untimely death.

item.title: Ghoulies w/ Gale Banks
item.description: This week we're joined once again by automotive industry legend Gale Banks (Facebook) founder of Banks Power. As is usually the case, we take a trip through Gale's storied past this time delving into kiwi jet boat racing, coyote panthers, radio controlled lawnmowers, Burt Monroe's sex life, Freightliners and top fuel drag cars. In addition we discuss the current maladies involving the Z06 overheating issues.

item.title: Doppelgängers
item.description: This week Matt and I sit down to catch up on the news, swap stories and meander through conversation. We talk about the endless stream of men that resemble Matt, updates on my Corvette "GT3" project, C7 Z06 overheating, Carplay & Android Auto integration, Matt's trepidation in daily driving a Focus RS, Lexus IS & RC lineup, the new 2016 Cadillact CTS-V and how it stacks up against ze Germans, rising Skyline R32 prices, my adventures in carbon fiber and the Top Gear crew's move to Amazon.

item.subtitle: This week Matt and I sit down to catch up on the news, swap stories and meander through conversation. We talk about the endless stream of men that resemble Matt, updates on my Corvette "GT3" project, C7 Z06 overheating, Carplay & Android Auto integratio
item.summary: This week Matt and I sit down to catch up on the news, swap stories and meander through conversation. We talk about the endless stream of men that resemble Matt, updates on my Corvette "GT3" project, C7 Z06 overheating, Carplay & Android Auto integration, Matt's trepidation in daily driving a Focus RS, Lexus IS & RC lineup, the new 2016 Cadillact CTS-V and how it stacks up against ze Germans, rising Skyline R32 prices, my adventures in carbon fiber and the Top Gear crew's move to Amazon.

item.title: Burning Fury Man Road
item.description: This week our good friends and co-conspirators from the /Drive network Mike Musto (@MDMusto) and Alex Roy (@AlexRoy144) join us to catch up and cover all the usual subject matter. This week filming was thwarted by a park ranger, Nino buys a Cyboard, society collapses in a small Nevada town and we compare the Dinan M4 to its natural competition in the form of the F-Type R and AMG GT.

item.title: Turning Out
item.description: This week Matt and I are joined in the studio once again by friend of TST Rick Radcliffe. We start off with an off topic conversation on watches specifically Matt's new GuardsRed watch and my new Apple Watch. From there we cover Rick's cross country trip in the million mile Lexus and its likely former life as a roaming Floridian bass and ecstasy dispensary. From there all three of us discuss the various states of disuse and/or repair of our Corvettes and we wrap up with Matt's review of the Dinan BMW M4 and the 034 Motorsport TT RS.

item.title: Hi Roger
item.description: After many weeks of travel everybody is back in the studio for a regular podcast. This week Matt shares his take on the Mercedes GLE63, we discuss the harsh realities of canabalism, an RX300 is freed from its confines, Confederate flags are everywhere, Thad forgets about Ivy league acceptance and we debate the merits of Lamborghini SUVs.

item.title: Rally North America (yes, still on the road)
item.description: Once again the guys have sent me another remote recording from a hotel for editing and ultimatale your listening pleasure. This time they're talking with Tony and Scott of Rally North America. Up first is a brief discussion on why Cobras and Slingshots are a bad choice for a rally, followed thereafter by mild offroading in a Corvette, the proliferation of the Confederate flag, a wavering Alfa Romeo 4C and of course the charity behind Rally North America; Hope for the Warriors.

item.title: Wallsittin'
item.description: Once again on the road; the guys are recording from the reclusive Farah complex somewhere along the northeastern seaboard and are joined by /Drive presenter, mascot, bishop and midwife Mr. Mike Spinelli. This week the finer points of improvised defecation are covered as is an in depth review of the Cadillac ATS-V, a visit to NASA, adulation for Goodwood, the 4th of July and the Rolls Royce Phantom EV.

item.title: SLC Pod
item.description: This podcast was recorded at the end of the All Cars Go To Heaven 2 adventure. The guys try to recap the experience without giving too much away before the film is edited and released.

item.title: It Begins
item.description: This week the guys are in Phoenix preparing to embark on the adventure that will become All Cars Go To Heaven 2. A day of wandering through the blistering Phoenix heat was spent finding cars for the trip. In addition to the beater cars. In addition John Bothwell of PurSang will be joining the guys in his Model T and they discuss the mods necessary for it to survive this trip.

item.title: Forza 6 Press Preview
item.description: This week Matt and I made our way north to Adam Carolla's studios in Burbank for a Forza Motorsport 6 preview with some hands-on time with the new game. We sit down with friend of the show Dan Greenawalt (creative director of Turn 10 studios) and talk about the new game and as a bonus Carcast's own Matt D'Andria joins us for the discussion. In addition to Forza 6 we've got a fresh clip of the new Mustang GT350R that gives a much better impression of the final product and we get face time with the Focus RS and new Ford GT.

item.title: Almost an Evo
item.description:
DSMs... one of the big cars of the early 2000s import scene, Matt finds out what it's like to drive one that has been built very well. In addition we talk about tackling projects without a proper budget, automatic seatbelts, middle men, mexican interior work, fuel filters the new Ford GT and Larry Kosilla's ever evolving 964.

Oh... and Matt's Mustang is done.

item.title: Grid Life
item.description: This week we talk about the Grid Life Music & Motorsports festival that Matt MC'd over the weekend while reviewing the new BMW M235i and a 2015 Hennessey Supercharged Mustang GT. Otherwise it's all the usual BS with the occassional piece of useful information peppered throughout.

item.title: Around the World
item.description: This week Jeff Glucker (@jglucker) of Hooniverse joins us again as we recap the TST world tour. Matt has just returned from a trip to Monaco to watch the grand prix with his father, Jeff gives us the gift of ridiculous Nurburgring stories, we discuss the Corvette factory in Bowling Green Kentucky, the new Z06, the general debacle that was the Camaro launch event and some quality time was spent with Jaguar and Range Rover in their newest F Type and Sport variants.

item.title: Golf R vs WRX STi + Magnacharger C7
item.description: This week we're joined by Tim Whitcome, a long-time friend and occassional contributor to the efforts at TST. Matt and Tim discuss "Speed Secrets" a pre-pilot show that brought Matt to LA for the first time. We review the Golf R and WRX STi while comparing them to the impending Focus RS. Additionally Matt got some seat time in Magnacharger's supercharged C7 Corvette and we talk Carplay radios.

item.title: Fast but not so Furious
item.description: We've got an old friend in the studio this week one Craig Lieberman (@CraigLieberman). Craig is one of the unsung heroes of the Fast and Furious franchise, he tells the story of how he went from car geek to consultant on what is now one of the largest film franchises ever. Paul Walker's Supra in the fast and furious was quite literally Craig's car that was leased to the studio for the film and his Skyline was one of the hero cars from Fast and Furious 2.

item.title: Broken Vocals and Runway Racing
item.description: This week we're joined by AJ Gordon of The Petersen Automotive Museum and the Car Stories podcast. AJ came by to inform our audience that The Petersen is doing a little fundraising to help restore their 1948 Davis Divan via IndieGogo. An admittedly strange car but nonetheless and important part of Los Angeles' history. Matt is fresh back from announcing half mile runway racing and he left half of his vocal chords on the track; while I'm down for the count this week with laryngitis. In addition we cover importing Japenese classics, the 2015 Subary WRX STi, the possibility of a revamped Honda CRZ and a somewhat surprising comparison of the C6 Z06 vs the C7 Z06.

item.title: Patriot's Day
item.description: Recorded on many people's favorite holiday; Patriot's Day (April 20th) we sat down at the podcast table for the first time in a couple weeks. Matt is fresh back from Germany on the /Drive NBC shoot. While there he got some hands on time with the Mercedes C63 S and he has tails from general insanity at Bilderberg and the Nurburgring. Halfway through recording Jeff Glucker from Hooniverse joins us at the table and we discuss the Audi S3 vs Golf R and how they may stack up against the Focus RS.

item.title: Late for Class
item.description: This week we're joined by our friend Rick Radcliffe a man with much patience (auto-shop teacher). Rick arrived in his newly purchased C5 ZO6 and we meander through various subject matter as usual. However Rick didn't swing by just to bullshit, he wanted us to help grade his student's Top Gear Challenge assignments.

item.title: Mostly BS
item.description: This week we're joined by Bodie Stroud (@BodieStroud) founder and namesake of the well known hot rod shop BS Industries. Bodie has been in the business a long time and shares his experience in running a high-end shop, working with client's, and managing projects while maintaining an artistic influence to expensive fabrication projects. We talk suspension, welding, CNC and all the things you'd expect but we also touch on drunk gaming, SEMA, bro-trucks, Fast and Furious 7 and even a bizarre pizza fetish.

item.title: I live in a van down by the river!
item.description: This week we're joined by ben from KombiLife.com (@HastaAlaska). Ben hales from the Isle of Jersey and has set out on a journey to travel from Chile to Alaska in a Volkswagen Bus (aka Kombi). Ben did not disappoint with tales of his long journey and the road ahead in what has become an exceptional story.

item.title: Virtual Podcast
item.description: This week Matt, Zack and myself catch up in studio on what we've been up to and ramble through whatever else comes to mind. Zack went drifting in his Crown Vic at Sonoma Raceway, we discuss the merits of full EV cars vs hybrids, Matt flogged a highly modified Saab 900 Turbo and updated on his Mustang and I installed a new Magnaflow catback on my Fiesta ST.

item.title: Exhausted Myths
item.description: This week we welcome Richard Waitas of Magnaflow exhaust. Richard has an extensive background in engineering and worked his way up through the Magnaflow organization. With a lot of fabrication, development, testing and design time under his belt Richard debunked a lot of the myths behind exhaust designs. In addition we cover some concepts in tuning air fuel mixes, usage of nitrous oxide and Richard's mobile workshop. Meanwhile Matt gives us an update on his Mustang, we talk a little about the new Focus RS, my Fiesta ST and a multitude of other topics.

item.title: I woke up in an old Bugatti
item.description: This week we're joined by John Bothwell Commercial Director of Pur Sang Automotive of Argentina. Pur Sang builds what are referred to as "continuation cars" which basically amount to exact recreations of classic cars built entirely by hand. Some might dismiss Pur Sangs Bugattis as kit cars but you'd be hard pressed to tell the difference between an original factory Bugatti and a Pur Sang continuation built in exactly the same manner as the original. We spend a lot of time talking classic Bugattis, middle-eastern extravagance, manufacturing and the quirks of doing business in Argentina.

item.title: Talkin' Shit
item.description: This week we're talking with comedian and noted podcaster Eddie Ifft (@eddieifft). We cover what is and is not appropriate behavior in middle-eastern monarchies, partying with $50 hookers, commandeering boats, the emergence of standup in the east, middle eastern toilets, sketchy amusement parks (Action Park) taxidermy and of course Eddie's new mobile podcast studio built in a short bus.

item.title: Adventure Time with Amy Lerner
item.description: This week we're joined by Amy Lerner (@TeamLerner) driver for the Team Lerner Racing an off-road/adventure team. Amy (a chronic over-achiever) has jumped from wallstreet, to being a full-time mom only to end up as a prominent offroad driver in the Rallye Aicha des Gazelles. Amy tells the tale of how she went from dipping her toes into off-roading to becoming a staple in her series' of choice.

item.title: We're Moving to New Zealand
item.description: Rain drifting, weird speed limits, no cops, and a ride in something too fast for the WRC. This is the podcast from TST's New Zealand Adventure. The Smoking Tire podcasts on the last night of their New Zealand trip. Our guests are Andrew Lamb and Caswal Parker, the founders of the game Automation, which lets you design cars and engines and then test them on the track and on the market. They thought TST should see what cars Kiwis make, so they paid our airfare and brought us to the island of GT-Rs, cheap Evos, and incredible DIY race cars, to show us why this country's car culture could be the best.

item.title: Andrew Johnson from Wheelwell
item.description: This week Matt and I are joined by Andrew Johnson co-founder of Wheelwell a new social networking site tailored to the automotive community. We of course talk about Wheelwell and how it serves the community vs. forums and older sites like CarDomain but we also cover his track prepped C5 Vette, Pfadt and LG suspension parts, IRS Foxbodyies, the new Ford GT, bargain bin 996 Porsches, the maladies of selling minivans and I share my thoughts on the 2015 Ford F150 Ecoboost.

item.summary: This week Matt and I are joined by Andrew Johnson co-founder of Wheelwell a new social networking site tailored to the automotive community. We of course talk about Wheelwell and how it serves the community vs. forums and older sites like CarDomain but we also cover his track prepped C5 Vette, Pfadt and LG suspension parts, IRS Foxbodyies, the new Ford GT, bargain bin 996 Porsches, the maladies of selling minivans and I share my thoughts on the 2015 Ford F150 Ecoboost.

item.title: The Car Matchmaker
item.description: This week we're joined in studio by Spike Feresten (@SpikeFeresten) host of Car Matchmaker on Esquire. We cover Spike's deep love of Porsches, his time working with Jerry Seinfeld and cheating at gokart racing with David Letterman for the Late Show Team. In addition we talk Pebble Beach, the spite of Ferrari, Barn Finds and Matt cracks the wheels on his Corvette for a 3rd time.
item.author: Matt Farah & Zack Klapman
Matt Farah & Zack Klapman

item.summary: This week we're joined in studio by Spike Feresten (@SpikeFeresten) host of Car Matchmaker on Esquire. We cover Spike's deep love of Porsches, his time working with Jerry Seinfeld and cheating at gokart racing with David Letterman for the Late Show Team. In addition we talk Pebble Beach, the spite of Ferrari, Barn Finds and Matt cracks the wheels on his Corvette for a 3rd time.

item.title: Truthiness
item.description: This week we're joined by Brandon McAleer (@brendan_mcaleer) of Canda, Road & Track, TTaC as well as some BBC stuff alongside his compatriot one Mr. Jack Baruth (@JackBaruth) also of Road & Track, TTaC. This week we discuss the US Nissan Skyline market, Jack tells us about his time in a McLaren racecar and their 650S, we talk Detroit Auto Show, Ford GT, ATS-V, CTS-V, Boss 302 vs GT350, C7 vs C6 ZO6 and why a 996 track car makes very little sense. Also Matt got a moving violation on his bicycle.

item.title: 900k Mile Service
item.description: This week we're joined by Travis Okulski (@tokulski) Editor at Jalopnik along with Jeff Glucker (@JGlucker) co-founder of Hooniverse. Travis is in town for the Corvette Z06 launch and Jeff... well he was just killing time after recording a Hooniverse Podcast. With Travis' impending time in the Z06 we of course discuss that and the potential of its new 8 speed automatic. But we also touch on Top Gear, launching an M4 via a 5" curb, many bad Bob Dylan jokes, an update on Matt's Lexus LS400 and Nino's new status as a Vine celebrity.

Matt Farah & Zack Klapman

item.title: Short Lead to Late Term
item.description: Recorded just prior to Christmas Matt is back from a cross country drive with his girlfriend the proud owner of a Lexus LS400 nearing 900,000 miles. Zack in the mean-time has taken up quad-copter camera duty while Thad has resorted to filling his Fiesta with race gas to make obscene power and I didn't do a damned thing other than work and make cookies. This week we had a Mustang Ecoboost in and we discuss that along with our usual mix of barely socially responsible nonsense.

item.title: 2500+ HP
item.description: This week Paul and Todd of Everyday Driver (YouTube | Podcast) drop by to talk about their new film Mid-Engines and Mountains. The new film highlights the fun and differences found in driving an Alfa 4C, Porsche Cayman and Lotus Elise through... well mountains. In addition the guys rolled in with a brand new Charger Hellcat and the new holy grail of track-rats the Camaro Z28. This week Matt has the new Jaguar F-Type R (coupe) we discuss the Ferrari option debacle and we talk about the merits of gold in a carbon weave.

The new film highlights the fun and differences found in driving an Alfa 4C, Porsche Cayman and Lotus Elise through... well mountains. This week Matt has the new Jaguar F-Type R (coupe) we discuss the Ferrari option debacle and we talk about the merits of gold in a carbon weave.

item.title: Replay on Racing
item.description: This week we're joined by John Spar founder of Replay XD Cameras as well as our good friend Mike Musto (@MDMusto). We knew that John was responsible for developing some seriously impressive camera hardware at Replay what we didn't know was that his father was one of the founders of B&M and that he grew up at the height of drag racing in the San Fernando Valley. John shares his stories of racing, fabrication, running several successful businesses and how those endeavors ultimately culminated in the creation of Replay XD Cameras

item.title: Iconic
item.description: This week Jonathan Ward founder of Icon joins us. Most people know Icon for the absolutely insane attention to detail in their signature FJs and Broncos. We get the story behind Jonathan's move from life as a working actor into the automotive world. The Icon order backlog is deep and for good reason as Jonathan outlines the great lengths he his wife and their crew go to ultimately producing a product with few equals in quality.

item.title: 150th Episode Spectacular
item.description:
This week TST contributor Jonathon Klein (@Jonathon_Klein) is in town for the LA Auto Show and he joins us for our pre-Thanksgiving episode. Fresh off testing a BMW 1M w/ a V8 we sit down for a discussion that encompasses, Coachella Gypsy Cabs, minivan crash testing, Honda's quality issues, IROC-Z track cars, the uniform mediocrity of most modern V6s, Passat W8s, Jonathon gives us his take on the new Mustang Ecoboost vs GT, we talk about possible Fiesta ST suspension changes, C6 Grand Sport track cars and we cover some of the highlights of the LA Auto Show including...

  • Mustang GT350
  • Mercedes AMG GT
  • Cadillac ATS-V
  • Fisker/Galpin Mustang Rocket
  • Chevy ZR2 Pickup
  • Volkswagen Golf R

item.title: Migliaia Oaks
item.description: Fresh off the floor at the LA Auto Show Mike Spinelli (@Mikespin) and Roger Garbow (@RogerGarbow) join us. With the auto show in town we cover a lot of material including, the Mustang GT 350, Cadillac ATS-V, Mercedes AMG GT, Porsche 911 GTS, Jaguar F-Type, we discuss the basics of flat-plan crank V8s, Kia plies journalists with beer, Mullne makes a sad showing, Matt attempts to by a Skyline GT-R and Mike takes suggestions on what he should buy to replace his MR2.

item.title: Pajero Slingshot
item.description: Once again we're joined by Mr. Aaron Gold (@AboutCars). This week Matt reviews the Polaris Slingshot, Aaron tells his about his time working on Top Gear, we talk diesel vs gas engines, Zack and Thad drove Local Motors Drift Trikes and we wrap up with some talk about flight simulators and aeronautics.

item.title: Snorkel Chugging
item.description: Once again the collective that is The Smoking Tire has reconvened after much traveling. Matt returns and regales us with his trip to Mexico, Zack and Thad made their way to northern California to film a Ford Falcon rally car and immediately thereafter Thad drove from Texas to California with Mike Musto in matching Charger and Challenger Hellcats with a brief stint in a Viper. Additionally we get a little nostalgic for Acuras of old, Jaguar reveals their plans for an all wheel drive F-Type R, information starts leaking on the Cadillac ATS-V and we debate engine possibilities for the new Mustang GT350.

item.title: Autozam Infatuation
item.description: Our good friend and partner in podcasting Jeff Glucker (@jglucker) of Hooniverse joins us this week. We talk all about Matt and Jeff's experiences in the Challenger Hellcat in Washington D.C., Matt spent some time in the new Z4 road car immediately followed by track time BMW Z4 GT3 racecar, Matt spent some time with an obscure but great Autozam AZ-1, plus we discuss Jeff's project car "The Wombat" and interesting cars from SEMA 2014.

item.title: Return of Lieberman
item.description: Our good friend Jonny Lieberman (@mt_loverman) has once again joined us in the TST studio. Jonny is fresh off the MotorTrend Truck of they Year and shares that experience with us. Additionally we review the 2015 BMW M4, we discuss the real possibility of the C8 Corvette offering a mid-engine variant named the Zora, we compare and contrast the 2015 Mustang GT vs. Camaro Z28 while talking GT350 flat-plane engine rumors and Jonny shares his stories of the real-life pitfalls of hydrogen powered cars.

item.title: I swear I'm not creepy.... Scarin' Maron
item.description: This week we're joined by Joshua Ovenshire (@TheJovenshire) and Matt Raub (@MattRaub) of Smosh Games. Matt met the Smosh crew while in Europe promoting Forza Horizon 2. Among many things we cover YouTube stalkers, video production, pecking order in geek culture, sheep familiarity, Kevin Pollack, building an online audience while Farah and Josh share their love of Magic the Gathering. Additionally we help Josh pick out a new car and Farah recounts his first drunken encounter with Marc Maron.

item.title: Death, Certain Death and Imminent Death
item.description: This Week AJ Gordon of the Peterson Automotive Museum and the Car Stories podcast joins us in studio. We talk about the rennovation of the Peterson museum, gauche behavior at car shows, how jaded automotive media is, Ford GT pricing and whether or not the Hennessey Vemom GT is usable as a canyon carver.

item.title: Anti-Confederacy with Alonzo Bodden
item.description: This week we're joined by comedian and tv host Alonzo Bodden (@AlonzoBodden). You probably know Alonzo from Speed's 101 Cars You Must Drive or America's Worst driver along with a reoccuring role on the final season of Californication, but Alonzo didn't swing by to talk about David Duchovny. We get into Alonzo's long list of cars he has owned over the years as well as his collection of motorcycles.

item.title: All About the Context
item.description: For the first time in a little while we sit down without guests and catch up on what we've been up to. Matt and Thad both had an afternoon with the Alfa Romeo 4C and Challenger Hellcat, Zack bought a Crown Victoria detective car and I continued to produce way too many podcasts. In addition Matt talks about his trip to Europe for the Forza Horizon 2 launch event along with his first impressions of the game and a mini review of the Audi R8 V10+. We also cover the RS5 Cabriolet, disparity in YouTube content production, glory holes (yes again) and how much context can color language for use on televion.

item.title: Mustang Bench Battle w/ Matt D'Andria
item.description: This week Matt D'Andria (@Motorator) cohost of CarCast joins us in studio once again. Both Matts are building late-model fox body Mustangs and we compare the two cars. We talk about the upcoming Paul Newmann documentary (Winning: The Racing Life of Paul Newmann) that he has been working on alongside the rest of the Carolla crew. Additionally we cover the Celebrity Stock Car Race at Irwindale that Matt D'Andria will be participatig in, we also talk SEMA, Pebble Beach, celebrity racers and why Jettas smell like crayons.

item.title: Return from Pebble, HRE Wheels and Mike Musto
item.description: This week Alan & Patrick from HRE Wheels join us alongside our good friend Mike Musto (@MDMusto). With the HRE boys in house we of course dive deep into the world of aftermarket wheels but we also cover the Monterey Historics, the inflated 911 market, 550 Maranellos and John Frankenheimer's utterly batshit superchaged nitrous-fed Mercedes 560 SEC.

item.title: The greatest Lexus RC F podcast... in the world.
item.description: This week Mr. Aaron Gold (@AboutCars) joins us to discuss the Lexus RC F launch. In addition we spend an indordinate amount of time talking about mid-century busses, diesel abominations of the malaise era and why you should drive a 2015 Hyundai Genesis instead of a Dodge Viper.

item.title: Jessi Combs and the Afterburners
item.description: This week we're joined in studio by fabricator, daredevil and television host Jessi Combs (@TheJessiCombs). You'll probably know Jessi best from Overhaulin', Mythbusters and All Girls Garage but she came in to school us on chasing speed records at Bonneville in turbine powered batshit fueled "cars" that are way faster than anything you've ever driven. In addition we talk a bit about fabrication, her time working with Chip Foose and Chris Jacobs and possibly most impressive of all her win at King of Hammers. All of that plus the usual idiocy you've come to know us for.

item.title: Chromed & Cammed
item.description: This week Gary and Chris from Creations n' Chrome join us. These guys know their Mustangs producing 200+ mph cars, mid-engine Mustangs and all manner of other custom creations. Beyond Chris' obvious mechanical and engineering talents Gary brings some serious knowledge to the table in the world of body work and paint. The n' Chrome part of the business refers to their highly sought after chrome paint applications. Gary and Chris walk us through building SEMA cars, their standing mile experience and most importantly their tips on how to avoid A. being shot by the police and B. contesting tickets.

item.title: Grinds to Grids - Bucky Lasek
item.description: Legendary pro skater and Subaru pro driver Bucky Lasek (@BuckyLasek) joins us this week. We of course talk about Bucky's impressive career as a pro skater with too many medal finishes to count but we really dig into his current focus in the rally world. Bucky now drives for Subaru and has become a very accomplshed driver steadily climbing the ranks of the rally scene and even stealing the occassional win in other formats. We also get into Bucky's love of Porsches, Zack's run in with Google employees, an alphabet soup of BMWs and Pikes Peak vs Mt. Washington.

item.title: Atkinson Diet
item.description: This week fellow automotive journalist, chairman of Beer and Beards quarterly, and host of Ignition Jonny Lieberman (@mt_loverman) once again joins us at the podcast table. Matt recounts tales of learning to drive a manual transmission, hot stereos and a teenage butchering of a Subaru Legacy. Meanwhile Jonny bought a new Fiesta ST and shares with us his experience in the Nismo GTR and Challenger Hellcat. In addition we cover news on the Aston Martin Lagonda, Zombie Dust beer and Lamborghini Countach values.

item.title: Wildcat Heroine
item.description: Making our way through the Motortrend & Hot Road staff this week we welcome Elana Scherr (@challengeher) into the studio. Both Elana and Matt had the good fortune to spend a bit of time with the new Dodge Challenger Wildcat and it's genrous helping of 707HP. Elana is a horder of classic vehicles and we discuss her Opel GT, 70 Challenger, 76 Dart and how to write them off as business expenses. Additionally we cover how heroin preserves Mötley Crüe and The Rolling Stones, letters from the DMV and Zack's search for a new daily driver.

item.title: Prelude to Red Eyes
item.description: Fresh back from touring the US with Rally North America we squeeze in a podcast before Matt and Thad head back to New York for more filming. This week we recap Rally North America, a trip up Pikes Peak, review the Jeep Grand Cherokee SRT, talk about the newly rumoured flat-plane crank Mustang GT 350, shark attacks on our home beaches while Blake Rong of Autoweek and Hooniverse sits in for the first half of the show.

item.title: Biscuits and Glory
item.description: This week Matt, Thad and Zack check in from the road with Rally North America. The guys meet up with Larry Kosilla in New York and try out his newly modified 964 at Monticello. Comparisons are made between the seedier parts of New York, Philadelphia and Memphis. Racial epithets are used in Ohio, a 1963 Corvette Stringray with an LS1 swap is driven and a glory hole is discovered at a rural rest stop.

item.description:

We'll be back with a new episode next week.

item.title: Stage Florida and La Ferrari vs McLaren P1 vs Porsche 918 with a dash of Lamborghini Huracán
item.description:
Once again fellow automotive journalist and YouTube jockey extraordinaire Carlos Lago (@CarlosLago) joins us in our new studio. Carlos has been one hell of lucky bastard this year as he comes to us with his thoughts on the Ferrari LaFerrari, McLaren P1 and Porsche 918, the BMW M3/M4 twins as well as his recent trip to drive the Lamborghini Huracán.

Beyond that absolutely ridiculous list of vehicles we talk about Motor Trend Classic, Nitro Circus, print advertising, 240sx motor swaps and vintage Ferraris.

On top of that we review the base model Ford Focus, Thadius has Cobb upgrade his Fiesta ST to their Stage 3 package and Matt shares his stories from officiating the Wanna Go Fast 1/2 mile event in Chicago.

item.title: E3, Garnett Lee, Infiniti Q60 and Amazon Sybian Fulfillment
item.description:
This week Garnett Lee of Garnett on Games and John + Garnett join us to talk E3 and all the new driving games that we got our hands on at the show. This includes of Forza Horizon 2 (of course), The Crew, Drive Club, Gran Turismo 6 and Project Cars. In addition we also got to try out some of the new VR headset tech from Oculus Rift and Sony's Project Morpheus.

Beyond gaming Zack reviews the G37 I mean Infinity Q60 Convertible, we compare the Alfa 4c to the Boxster and we talk used hot hatches.

item.title: It burns when I DeLorean
item.description:
This week we bring you more of the usual car news while we opine and deliver stories you wouldn't be comfortable sharing with your aunt.

Topics this week include...

  • 2015 Corvette Z06
  • Forza Horizon 2
  • The growing dominiance of Über
  • Dual Clutch Transmissions vs fast conventional Automatics
  • Nearly super offensive URLs
  • Throwing rockis at Lamborghini Aventadors
  • Burning DeLoreans
  • Harrassing/Stalking shops that do the TST crew favors
  • Matt's Mustang Project
  • All Cars Go To Heaven
  • Starfield Ceilings

item.title: Turbos, Bitcoins and Rallying
item.description: This week we take a bit more of a relaxed approach to podcasting couchside at Chris' house. We dicscuss the reviews of All Cars Go To Heaven, filming with Joe Rogan and his Sharkwerks 911 GT3, Ferrari's moves into turbocharging, Aston Martin's engine collaboration with Mercedes, the basics of Bitcoins, Rally North American, legalized marijuana, and Zack revies the new Volkswagen GTI.

item.title: Prelude: All Cars Go To Heaven
item.description:
Back in August of 2013 we recorded a podcast immediately upon returning from filming All Cars Go To Heaven. This podcast is very much the companion piece to the film as Thad, Matt and Zack recount the trip to Nino and myself.

The trip was hatched from the ill depths of Thadius' mind and features an unreleased (at the time) Jeep Grand Cherokee Limited along with a genuine shitbox of a vehicle crossing Mt. Rainier, Mt. Hood and Mt. Saint Helens in the depths of Washington state.

item.title: Peacocking
item.description: Just back from Europe (Zack quite literally) we discuss the announcement of /Drive's move to NBC Sports and the resulting stories while filming alongside our good friend Jeff Glucker. While in Europe Matt and Zack spent some quality time with the Mercedes SLS Black, McLaren 650s and Ferrari F12 Berlinetta on their way to Monaco. Beyond the European excursion we touch upon listener questions and meander through various bits of news.

item.title: Regular Podcast
item.description: This week Mr. Regular and The Roman of Regular Car Reviews join us for an unholy cacaphony of grunting, dick jokes and the occassional mention of a car. Our guests arrive dressed in their finest as we talk about everybody's new favorite tv show Glasgow Today, the New York International Auto Show, the adventures of the Downsyndrome Knight, angry Jalopnik Commenters and of course the massively successful Fund Anything campaign that brought Regular Car Reviews to Los Angeles.

item.title: Car & Journal
item.description:
Once again the dynamic duo of Aaron Robinson (Car & Driver) and Dan Neil (@DanNeilWSJ) join us for a round of podcasting. Dan is fresh off of a BMW i8 press event and gives us his take on the i8 and i3. Aaron gives us a report on his long term Jaguar F-Type and later in the show we play a rousing game of "Guess the Horsepower". We also touch upon a multitude of other topics as can be found below.

  • modern motor oils
  • the state of Jaguar
  • Hyundai vs. Kia
  • Chevy SS Manual
  • Pebble Beach
  • Airstream trailers
  • Toyota departing California
  • Chevy Spark Electric

item.title: Straight Outta Compton
item.description: This week George "Motoman" Notaras joins us for the cavalcade of general insensitivity wrapped in the guise of automotive journalism we call our podcast. We spent some quality time with Dinan BMW 1 Series M along with the new 2014 Subaru WRX. We compare said WRX to Thad's modified Fiesta ST and follow it up with a little talk about the street racing scene in Compton. While in Compton Zack and Thad were likely filmed by the new drone overlords of the LA Count Sheriff's Department. All that and a little insight into the fraternity life of those that partook.

item.title: The Fixer
item.description: This week we are joined by famed Panamanian fixer from our travels to the land great canals; Joel Bolanos. Joel gives us the run-down on his famed Suzuki Samurai with a Sidekick motor swap, we take delivery of a BMW 1M from Dinan alongside the new Subaru WRX while discussing the car culture in Panama. Thad and Zack spend some quality time with the new Porsche 911 Turbo S, we share some not-so-kind words regarding the dilution of the C7 Z06 and Matt almost drives the new Camaro Z28.

item.title: Westbound and Down
item.description: This week Vinny Russo (of Lamborghini USA) and Rob Ferretti (of Gotham Dream cars and Super Speeders) join us to wax poetic on all the usual bullshit while Vinny teaches us to pronounce Huracán . We touch upon the provenance of McLaren in the world of supercars along with the logistics of maintaining high dollar vehicles. Zack, Thad and Myself visit Exotics Racing to try out the new 991 Porsche 911 Turbo S, Nissan GTR and Ferrari 458 on their southern California track at AutoClub Speedway.

item.title: Vulgar Review of Power
item.description: This week we bring you our perspective on the 2014 SRT10 Viper alongside the Ring Brothers 1971 Pantera. Thad's Fiesta ST gets another round of upgrades (stage 2) from our friends at Cobb Tuning. Additionally Zack and Thad recount their experience at Laguna Seca driving a wide variety of cars including the BMW M235i, WRX STi, Volvo XC60, Mercedes E63 AMG, Jeep SRT8 and the new S Class.

item.title: Polishing a Turd
item.description: This week we round up the 3 finest detailers in North America to hone the finish on.... a Fox Body Notchback with incredibly shitty paint. We brought nuclear warheads to a knife fight, but sometimes that's just how we do things. Jason Rose (Meguiars), Kevin Brown (Buff Daddy.com) and of course our very own Larry Kosilla (AMMO NYC) dive deep into the world of detailing. This episode represents a commitment to cleaning and presentation that would make your mother proud. Although we still discourage sharing these shows with your mom. All that plus the detail masters answer listener questions.

item.title: McLaren P1 vs. Porsche 918
item.description: Once again our friend Carlos Lago of Motor Trend joins us for an extended podcast. Carlos recently tested both the McLaren P1 and Porsche 918 so of course we cover that, but we also review the XKR-S GT, the Cadillac ELR and its stablemate the CTS V-Sport. In addition to the reviews we touch on meat based furniture and clothing, Grand Theft Auto 5, stupid tweeting cars, Zack's recently acquired tickets and how Chris suggests he evades them.

item.title: Terminator Power Bottom
item.description: This week our good friends from Car and Driver Aaron Robinson and Tony Quiroga stop by to regale us with tales of unfettered access and actual production budgets. The topics are many and varied this week; we cover Aaron's time in Belfast along with his new F-Type farm, Tony arrives with his recently acquired 993 Porsche, Matt buys an IRS for his Fox Body project, and of course we cover all the interesting stuff coming out of Geneva Motor Show this year.

item.title: Heavyweight Champion
item.description: Newly annointed creator of the world's fastest production vehicle (the Venom GT) John Hennessey swings by to have a chat. In addition to the record setting run, we talk about the McLaren P1, the Porsche 918, working with NASA the scrutineers at Guinness and the current insanity of the hypercar world.

item.description: Straight from a tour of roadside landmarks we review the brand new Audi A8L Diesel along with stories from law enforcement, truck stop weaponry and pez dispensors.

item.title: If I had a hammer.
item.description: This week we sit down to discuss important things like Matt's need to buy unnecessary cars, the King of Hammers, cheeky british saloons with 550HP (Jaguar XFR-S) aftermarket seats, and LA's worst/best strip club/burlesque show Jumbo's Clown Room. Strap in, take a sip and lean back it's another week of ridiculous crap.

item.title: Astro Van Express
item.description: Our good friends Larry Kosilla (AMMO NYC, Drive Clean) and Mike Musto (Big Muscle, Road & Track) join us at the podcasting table once again. This week we review the Chevy SS and the Jeep Cherokee Diesel. Also we cover Larry's less than ideal ride to the airport, the Forza Motorsport Smoking Tire car pack, Axe Body Spray, camping in the desert BMW Z8s and winter car care.

item.title: Beardtacular
item.description: This week after a long absence Jonny Lieberman rejoins us at the podcasting table alongside his Source Interlink compatriot Carlos Lago. Frankly this episode is really really long coming in at nearly two and a half hours. We cover beards, the Bieber arrest, E46 vs Fiesta outrage, the new Subaru WRX, the AMG G63 6x6, rather explicit fan letters, the Venom GT, AMS Alpha 12 GT-R and the Pagani Huayra. Strap in, this one just goes and goes.

item.title: Krautwerk
item.description: This week Steve Dinan purveyor of all things BMW joins us to talk about how he got into the business and the current state of BMW tech. Of course we touch upon the history of BMW but we spend a long time discussing how factory turbocharging has unleashed new potential and where things may be going in the future. We discuss the realities of research and development, Steve defines "Turbo Lag" for us and using vacuum in the crankcase for power increases.

item.title: Happy Tree Racing
item.description: This week we welcome back our friend Duncan Ende (@DuncanEnde) who has recently taken the helm of a Prototype Challenge car in the IMSA TUDOR Championship series driving for RSR Racing. This week we discuss the virtual wasteland that is Indianapolis, GTD Cars, the gorgeous new C7R, what it's like to drive an open cockpit racecar in the wet, and Duncan's Le Mans ambitions. Additionally we touch on blinding shift lights, Bob Ross, the drunken outfield of Sebring, Veyrons, Koenigsegg's crazy cam-less cylinder heads, Rolex's and Matt outlines the most efficient way to pick up a stripper.

item.title: GarageBand Sucks
item.description:
So... this week as we wrapped up recording and I attempted to save the recording (like the reckless asshole I am) GarageBand promptly started throwing a fit and ultimately destroyed the second half of the recording.

Since we got a solid hour of podcasting in before the recording was trashed I decided an hour of a quality podcasting was better than none.

Those problems aside, this week we welcome Travis Langness of Edmunds to the podcast table. We review the Range Rover LWB, Travis talks about Edmund's long term 2005 CLS65 AMG and we discuss the controversy surrounding the Fiesta ST vs BMW E46 M3 video.

item.title: Deadliest Catch
item.description: This week we welcome back our good friend Jeff Glucker of Hooniverse and American Detours to help us close out 2013. We discuss Jeff's W123 Mercedes Hemi swap "The Wombat", Thad buys himself a brand new Fiesta ST, Matt geeks out on Back to the Future and Chris manages to knock his mic over mid show. We also touch on the Aston Martin V12 Vantage S, the Lamborghini Countach and we list the favorite cars we drove over the course of the year.

item.title: Everybody Loves Romanov
item.description:
This week we sit down with Carlos Lago (@caroloslago) of MotorTrend and Ignition to talk about just about everything. The topics are varied and this one comes in at over 2 hours so here's what we covered.

  • Lamborghini Aventador
  • Infotainment Stacks and why don't manufacturers just give us USB and Bluetooth
  • Merceded SLS AMG Black
  • Porsche 991 Turbo
  • Focus ST vs. Fiesta ST
  • C6 Police Chase here in Los Angeles
  • Reckless driving habits in the canyons.
  • MotorTrend's 240 SX project
  • Viper vs. C7 Corvette
  • Turbo GMC Canyon
  • Porsche 918
  • Chevy SS
  • Cadillac CTS V-Sport
  • The Russion version of Everybody Loves Raymond
  • The new Mercedes SL
  • Dragon Jeep
  • Automated manual transmissions vs. dual clutch transmissions

item.description: This week we announce the winners of our 100th episode giveaway.

item.title: You're not my real Dad.
item.description:
This week we welcome Mr. Regular and The Roman from Regular Car Reviews if you don't know them yet you should; we find them absolutely hilarious. This week we cover morning zoos, Nissan Stanzas, Wilford Brimley, La Forzas, Dodge Rams, bukkake, Grand Nationals and generally dive into the depths of utter depravity.

On a markedly more somber note we address the untimely passing of Roger Rodas and Paul Walker whom we knew to varying degrees but unanimously respected. If ever there were a time to dedicate an episode in memorandom it is most definitely now.

item.title: The Century Mark
item.description:
Afte nearly two years of podcasting we reach our 100th episode. Beyond the milestone we also celebrate the delivery of Matt's long awaited DeLorean. In this episode we cover the Rolls Royce Wraith, the 2015 Mustang, Turbo BMW E30s, the "troubles" in Ireland, sturdy redneck genes and Lambo doors. Additionally Zack does his take on the film Snatch while we all immitate Michael Caine and the Queen Mum.

Thanks for listening, the ride is just beginning.

item.title: Launch Control
item.description:
This week we welcome back Dan Greenawalt of Turn10 Studios to cap off the Forza 5 coverage. Just a couple of days prior to the XBox One launch Dan walks us through the final build of the game as we take turns playing during the podcast.

Topics Covered

  • Dev Crunch
  • Collaboration with Top Gear
  • Hiring a creative team
  • The overall creative process when developing Forza
  • The XBox One launc
  • Breaking Aston Martins
  • Crazy race built GMC Syclones
  • Dan's M3

item.title: Spam, Anger, Aventadors and SEMA
item.description:
This week on The Smokin Tire

  • Matt visits the DMV
  • An Aventador was procured and subsequently driven to Las Vegas
  • Taxis escort supercars
  • Nino brings us all delicious snacks
  • Matt's DeLorean is nearly finished
  • We discuss our time at SEMA
  • Zack is preparing for a cross country drive in an M3
  • What is the best rental car for a west coast vaction?
  • We prepare for a roadtrip to Reno.

item.title: The Truth About Little
item.description: Fresh back from SEMA we are joined by Jack Baruth and another gentleman that absolutely is not his brother Bark Maruth. We talk about the differences in street cars vs. track prepped street cars vs. race cars, driving instruction and cross continent records. In addtion we cover a bit of what we encountered at SEMA along with the experience of driving a Lamborghini Aventador from Los Angeles to Las Vegas for the SEMA show.

item.title: Transverse Skidmark
item.description: This week Mike Musto, Chris Harris, Mike Spinelli and JF Musial of /Drive join us and as usual it's a complete melee. We start off discussing our respective ages soon to follow with admiration for Nino's beard. Chris Harris gets a taste of Los Angeles by sharing a hotel with bikers and driving through South Central. We talk about the reorganization of GM and Chrysler, the merits of transverse leafsprings, meanwhile touching upon important cultural figures such as Vanilla Ice, M.C. Hammer, Ice T and of course drunk Hitler.

item.title: XBoned
item.description: This week we got some hands-on time with the X-Box One (aka XBone) and Forza Motorsport 5 courtesy of our friens over at Turn 10 Studios. Additionally we've just returned from the single largest vehicle shoot in /Drive's history. We touch on the 911 Carrera S, C7 Corvette, Fiesta ST, BMW M5 and many more.

item.title: Revere Rides Again
item.description:
Paul and Todd from Everyday Driver sit down and talk with us about their new documentary 50 Years of the 911. In addition we cover how cars acquire character as they age, the Tesla Model S, YouTube "rentals", the current drama at Morgan automotive and Matt talks about his time spent with the new Audi RS7.

Normally this is where I attempt to inject some humor but I'm struggling to stay awake, so insert your own damn joke on the line provided _______________________________________

item.title: Los Egoistas
item.description: This week Vinny Russo of Lamborghini North America joins us along with Mike Musto whom you all probably already know. We of course talk Lambos, we also discuss Vinny's experience on Bull Run and the Silver State Classic. In addition to those stories we discuss the balancing fun, entertainment and responsibility and the double standards that automotive journalists are held to. Oh yeah and Matt contracted Panamanian lung AIDS.

item.title: Canalingus
item.description: Thad, Matt, Zack and Tom return from a Tuned shoot in Panama; bringing us all the gift their perspective but also dick and fart jokes. First up, diesel Ford Rangers are apparently a thing that happens as is incessant honking, highly modified Suzuki Samurais, "casino" hookers, 900HP Evoloutions VIIs, and hurdling behemoths modified to the hilt known as Diablo Rojo buses. All that and more on yet another episode of what is undeniably the most crass automotive podcast nobody ever asked for, The Smoking Tire.

item.title: iProstate
item.description: This week we convene without a guest, but we don't need one because Matt and Zack have driven plenty of new cars in the last week. At the Chyrsler press event the Ram Pro Master, Dart GT, Fiat 500e, Cherokee Trail Hawk and Grand Cherokee diesel were all abused and thrown recklessly enthusiastically driven, occassionally with passengers in designated cargo areas. Matt also shares his experience with the mid-cycle refresh of the Panamera to be followed by discussions of flight lessons, high class hobos, and pizza delivery.

item.title: Rimmed
item.description: Alan Peltier and Patrick Moran from HRE Wheels join us to discuss wheels of course. Alan dives deep into wheel design and construction, while we spout off with our usual barrage of bullshit. Additionally Alan teaches us what to look for when purchasing wheels. Beyond all the wheel talk Zack spent some time with a new Tesla Model S and Matt had the good fortune of spending an afternoon with a Lexus LFA.

item.title: "Animal Husbandry"
item.description: This week Garnett Lee of Weekend Confirmed and Editorial Director of GameFly Media joins us in studio. We talk about Garnett's vehicle history including his new Boxster. Rolling with the theme of vehicle history we discuss highschool car culture in the late 90s. After the trip down memory lane we find time to discuss tires, the new Mini JCW GP, stolen iPhones, Gwar and tire modeling in racing games. Also Zack and Matt just returned from Nevada where they particpated in the Silver State Classic, encountered a racist rodea clown (redundant?) and Matt uknowingly purchases a stolen iPhone.

item.summary: This week Garnett Lee of Weekend Confirmed and Editorial Director of GameFly Media joins us in studio. We talk about Garnett's vehicle history including his new Boxster. Rolling with the theme of vehicle history we discuss highschool car culture in the late 90s. After the trip down memory lane we find time to discuss tires, the new Mini JCW GP, stolen iPhones, Gwar and tire modeling in racing games. Also Zack and Matt just returned from Nevada where they particpated in the Silver State Classic, encountered a racist rodea clown (redundant?) and Matt uknowingly purchases a stolen iPhone.

item.title: Knifey Spoony
item.description: This week we welcome Rich Fowler of Motorsport Retro. We spend a bit of time talking F1 stuff mostly Prost vs. Senna and of course the new Räikkönen + Ferrari alliance. We touch upon the mertis of Australia's V8 Super Car series vs NASCAR, the reckles aussie abandon that is Bathhurst, and of course Australia's most famous vehicles the utes. Beyond all of that and our usual brand of bullshit, Rich is simply floored by our outlook on electric vehicles and hybrids; the Volt and Tesla Model S specifically.

item.title: World's Smartest Monkey
item.description: This week we convene sans guest, that being said we make do. Matt discusses his upcoming moderation of "Black Air" (Grand National Documentary) at the Jalopnik Film Festival. Zack and Thad share tales of drag racing station wagons. We thoroughly lambast the appearance of the Shelby Raptor, lust over a 64 Corvette autocross special, Matt reviews the Range Rover Sport, we say many kind words about Greg Fitzsimmons and more...

item.summary: This week we convene sans guest, that being said we make do. Matt discusses his upcoming moderation of "Black Air" (Grand National Documentary) at the Jalopnik Film Festival. Zack and Thad share tales of drag racing station wagons. We thoroughly lambast the appearance of the Shelby Raptor, lust over a 64 Corvette autocross special, Matt reviews the Range Rover Sport, we say many kind words about Greg Fitzsimmons and more...

item.title: Concours d'Ignorance
item.description:
I'll get right to the cool stuff, Matt put 300 miles on a brand new C7 Corvette Stingray and Zack spent some time with the 2014 911 Turbo S. Now the rest of this post is likely superfluous but what kind of sorry excuse for a podcaster/blogger would I be if I didn't expound a bit?

Beyond two of the biggest names in sporting things with 4 wheels, Matt and Zack both made their ways to Europe and brought us the gift of stories from the "old country" and likely unending jealousy for many of our listeners. Matt visited Koenigsegg and spent some time with their test driver as they flogged an Agera R for an afternoon; you know when he wasn't busy touring the continent in a brand new M6 Coupé (accent added for additional euro flavour (also the u because I'm feeling international)). Whilst making his way across the continent the M6 may or may not have spanked a Ferrari 458.

If that wasn't enough Zack flew over to Germany to film the 2014 911 Turbo S for Tangent Vector, and it seems as though Porsche may have produced a car that is good. In a different part of the country Matt was busy making his way around the Nürburgring Nordschleife because racecar.

Oh yeah, and of course everybody is back from Pebble Beach and the Concours d'Elegance. We make fun of snooty old money guys wearing stupid pants, the autmotive journalists who believe they're mocking them (even though they really aren't) and our plans for next years appearance at Pebble.

All of that and the requisite number of dick and fart jokes.

item.title: Around the Shrimp Bowl
item.description:
This week we put too many damned people on mic. Mike Spinelli and Travis Okulski from Jalopnik join us alongside Doug Demuro of Plays with Cars and the rest of the usual crew with a half intoxicated Dan Neil and Blake Rong shouting things at us from the background.

The topics run long and varied on this episode here's the breakdown.

  • Jalopnik's Road Trip to Pebble Beach
  • Jaguar F-Type & XFR-S
  • Lemons newest spectacle the upside down Camaro
  • Matt drives a turbocharged Chevy Colorado
  • We once again expound on the heaping pile that is the Mercedes G Wagon
  • Ridiculous warranty abuse at Carmax
  • We discuss John Salley's boner pills
  • Travis spent some time in the Hennessey Turbo Ferrari 458
  • Travis being the lucky bastard he is also got an Audi RS7 for a week alongside a Porsche Cayman S
  • Spinelli regales us with tales of his youth and using a Bitter SC to buy doughnuts
  • Stories from the famed Stelvio Pass
  • We teach Matt about Klout
  • And finally we discuss Wheel of Fortune if it were to be filmed in Wales.

item.title: Turbo Stuff
item.description:
This week we invite Gale Banks of Banks Power and "Special" Dan Neil of the Wall Street Journal into the studio. Of course with Mr. Banks in the house we spent copious amounts of time discussing diesel engines and turbocharging technology. Additionally we covered Banks' new StraightShot Water/Methanol Injection system, jake brakes, Jetta TDis, Turbocharged 5 Cylinder Chevy Colorados, tuning a BMW 335, Pikes Peak and of course Dan convinces Gale to lend him a racecar.

If you like the show please leave us a review on iTunes.

item.title: Doctor Professor Doctor
item.description:
This week we welcome our old friend Larry Kosilla of Ammo Autocare and Drive Clean as well as our new friend George Notaras of Motoman.tv and inside the Motoman studio. We of course talk detailing, Larry answers a few questions and we celebrate his new status as Bugatti's official detailer. George regales us with stories of hunting down stolen iPhones, German executives and his other gig outside of the automotive world as a standup comedian.

2 hours - 46MB

You should also check out Larry's podcast Drive and Protect here on shoutengine.

item.title: The Thaddeus Initiative
item.description: This week we sit down and prepare for the an entirely off road trip through Washington state as planned by Thad. We spend some time digging through Craigslist for beater trucks and discussing plans for the trip. In addition we have both Matt and Zack's long term impressions of the Volt we discuss it's cousn the Cadillac ELR and Matt tells us about his time with the Mitsubish Evolution 311RS.

item.title: Wheel Nipples
item.description:
We invite Dave Engelman @PorscheDave09 into the studio this week to talk all things Porsche. Dave is the Communications Manager for Porsche North America and is an all around knowledgeable car guy. This week we cover...

  • The new 911 GT3 (991)
  • The Porsche Macan
  • "Over Revs"
  • PDK and dual clutch transmissions in general.
  • Diesel Technology.
  • The Cayenne
  • 4.0 Liter Caymans
  • Singer 911s
  • Magnus Walker
  • the Road & Track reboot
  • VW A.G. and where Porsche fits into the mix.
  • The Porsche Experience Center in Carson California
  • How to get a job in the car industry.
  • And of course the Panamera.

item.title: My son is a lesbian.
item.description: This week Tony Quiroga of Car and Driver joins us (via a 2014 SLS Black) for an episode with frankly too many cars. We talk about the new Roush Stage 3 Mustang, Zack gets a Volt press car, Chris opines on the 2014 Impala, Matt imparts some consumer advice while maligning the anticlimatic exit of electric cars. In addition we cover gay cowbotys, Connecticut Mobsters, the Top Gear mower, camber tires, The Price is Right, the brand new Maserati Ghibli and last but not least the 2014 european Volkswagen GTi.

item.title: Smoking Carcast?
item.description: This week Matt D'Andria co-host of Carcast and host of GQ's Car Collectors joins us in studio and this one goes for a while. We talk about Jeff Dunham's Batmobile, the Ford GTX1, Tesla Model S, the new Mazda 3, Zack has an interesting story from the Playboy Mansion, Matt buys a Delorean, Bob Ross paintings, Danny Trejo's lowriders, Jay Leno's collection and we discuss Top Gear USA.

item.title: Clank = Shank
item.description: It's Nino's Birthday, Zack and Thad take a new 370Z roadster for an enthusiastic drive through Northern California, Matt visits Kennebunkport Maine after taking delivery on a brand new Chevy Volt, a new Roush Stage 3 Mustang waits in the driveway, we talk about the Honda CR-Z which should get excellent fuel economy, the C7 Corvette which actually gets good fuel economy, and Zack takes a ride with an old lady in a Lamborghini.

item.title: Forza 5
item.description: This week Dan Greenawalt creative director of Turn 10 Studios joins us to dig into the deep details of Forza 5. We get super in depth about physics modeling, specular lighting and particle effects among other things. We also talk about E3, the XBox One, McLaren P1, McLaren 12c, Porsche 918 and Dan's M3 project.
